17.quote: “And when at last you find someone to whom you feel you can pour out your soul, you stop in shock at the words you utter— they are so rusty, so ugly, so meaningless and feeble from being kept in the small cramped dark inside you so long.”
17.name: Sylvia Plath, The Unabridged Journals of Sylvia Plath

18.quote: “Before you, Bella, my life was like a moonless night. Very dark, but there were stars, points of light and reason. ...And then you shot across my sky like a meteor. Suddenly everything was on fire; there was brilliancy, there was beauty. When you were gone, when the meteor had fallen over the horizon, everything went black. Nothing had changed, but my eyes were blinded by the light. I couldn’t see the stars anymore. And there was no more reason, for anything.”
18.name: Stephenie Meyer, New Moon

19.quote: “I've got nothing to do today but smile.”
19.name: Simon and Garfunkel

20.quote: “I cannot teach anybody anything. I can only make them think”
20.name: Socrates

21.quote: “All women become like their mothers. That is their tragedy. No man does, and that is his.”
21.name: Oscar Wilde, The Importance of Being Earnest

22.quote: “Books say: She did this because. Life says: She did this. Books are where things are explained to you; life is where things aren't. I'm not surprised some people prefer books.”
22.name: Julian Barnes, Flaubert's Parrot

23.quote: “America will never be destroyed from the outside. If we falter and lose our freedoms, it will be because we destroyed ourselves.”
23.name: Abraham Lincoln

24.quote: “She says nothing at all, but simply stares upward into the dark sky and watches, with sad eyes, the slow dance of the infinite stars.”
24.name: Neil Gaiman, Stardust

25.quote: “Letting go doesn't mean that you don't care about someone anymore. It's just realizing that the only person you really have control over is yourself.”
25.name: Deborah Reber, Chicken Soup for the Teenage Soul: 101 Stories of Life, Love and Learning

26.quote: “Anyone whose goal is 'something higher' must expect someday to suffer vertigo. What is vertigo? Fear of falling? No, Vertigo is something other than fear of falling. It is the voice of the emptiness below us which tempts and lures us, it is the desire to fall, against which, terrified, we defend ourselves.”
26.name: Milan Kundera, The Unbearable Lightness of Being

27.quote: “That's why they call it the American Dream, because you have to be asleep to believe it.”
27.name: George Carlin

28.quote: “It's often just enough to be with someone. I don't need to touch them. Not even talk. A feeling passes between you both. You're not alone.”
28.name: Marilyn Monroe

29.quote: “I stood still, vision blurring, and in that moment, I heard my heart break. It was a small, clean sound, like the snapping of a flower's stem.”
29.name: Diana Gabaldon, Dragonfly in Amber

0.quote: “When I am with you, we stay up all night.When you're not here, I can't go to sleep.Praise God for those two insomnias!And the difference between them.”
0.name: Rumi

1.quote: “The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.”
1.name: Marcus Aurelius, Meditations

2.quote: “The pessimist complains about the wind; the optimist expects it to change; the realist adjusts the sails.”
2.name: William Arthur Ward

3.quote: “Have no fear of perfection - you'll never reach it.”
3.name: Salvador Dali

4.quote: “All the secrets of the world are contained in books. Read at your own risk.”
4.name: Lemony Snicket

5.quote: “Some lose all mind and become soul,insane.some lose all soul and become mind, intellectual.some lose both and become accepted”
5.name: Charles Bukowski

6.quote: “In life, unlike chess, the game continues after checkmate.”
6.name: Isaac Asimov

7.quote: “The only way to get rid of temptation is to yield to it.”
7.name: Oscar Wilde, The Picture of Dorian Gray

8.quote: “Appear weak when you are strong, and strong when you are weak.”
8.name: Sun Tzu, The Art of War

9.quote: “Clothes make the man. Naked people have little or no influence on society.”
9.name: Mark Twain

10.quote: “We are cups, constantly and quietly being filled. The trick is, knowing how to tip ourselves over and let the beautiful stuff out.”
10.name: Ray Bradbury

11.quote: “Tears shed for another person are not a sign of weakness. They are a sign of a pure heart.”
11.name: José N. Harris, MI VIDA: A Story of Faith, Hope and Love

12.quote: “Youth is happy because it has the capacity to see beauty. Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old.”
12.name: Franz Kafka

13.quote: “Remember to always be yourself. Unless you suck.”
13.name: Joss Whedon

14.quote: “People think that intimacy is about sex. But intimacy is about truth. When you realize you can tell someone your truth, when you can show yourself to them, when you stand in front of them bare and their response is 'you're safe with me'- that's intimacy.”
14.name: Taylor Jenkins Reid, The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo

15.quote: “When people don't express themselves, they die one piece at a time.”
15.name: Laurie Halse Anderson, Speak

16.quote: “You wanna fly, you got to give up the shit that weighs you down.”
16.name: Toni Morrison, Song of Solomon

17.quote: “The best thing for being sad," replied Merlin, beginning to puff and blow, "is to learn something. That's the only thing that never fails. You may grow old and trembling in your anatomies, you may lie awake at night listening to the disorder of your veins, you may miss your only love, you may see the world about you devastated by evil lunatics, or know your honour trampled in the sewers of baser minds. There is only one thing for it then — to learn. Learn why the world wags and what wags it. That is the only thing which the mind can never exhaust, never alienate, never be tortured by, never fear or distrust, and never dream of regretting. Learning is the only thing for you. Look what a lot of things there are to learn.”
17.name: T.H. White, The Once and Future King

18.quote: “I realize only one person will be damaged beyond repair if Peeta dies. Me.”
18.name: Suzanne Collins, Catching Fire

19.quote: “There are so many fragile things, after all. People break so easily, and so do dreams and hearts.”
19.name: Neil Gaiman, Fragile Things: Short Fictions and Wonders

20.quote: “The unreal is more powerful than the real. Because nothing is as perfect as you can imagine it. Because its only intangible ideas, concepts, beliefs, fantasies that last. Stone crumbles. Wood rots. People, well, they die. But things as fragile as a thought, a dream, a legend, they can go on and on. If you can change the way people think. The way they see themselves. The way they see the world. You can change the way people live their lives. That's the only lasting thing you can create.”
20.name: Chuck Palahniuk, Choke

21.quote: “I am selfish. I am brave.”
21.name: Veronica Roth, Divergent

22.quote: “Children must be taught how to think, not what to think.”
22.name: Margaret Mead

23.quote: “A good traveler has no fixed plans and is not intent on arriving.”
23.name: Lao Tzu

24.quote: “Was it hard?" I ask.Letting go?"Not as hard as holding on to something that wasn't real.”
24.name: Lisa Schroeder

25.quote: “Perhaps the greatest faculty our minds possess is the ability to cope with pain. Classic thinking teaches us of the four doors of the mind, which everyone moves through according to their need.First is the door of sleep. Sleep offers us a retreat from the world and all its pain. Sleep marks passing time, giving us distance from the things that have hurt us. When a person is wounded they will often fall unconscious. Similarly, someone who hears traumatic news will often swoon or faint. This is the mind's way of protecting itself from pain by stepping through the first door.Second is the door of forgetting. Some wounds are too deep to heal, or too deep to heal quickly. In addition, many memories are simply painful, and there is no healing to be done. The saying 'time heals all wounds' is false. Time heals most wounds. The rest are hidden behind this door.Third is the door of madness. There are times when the mind is dealt such a blow it hides itself in insanity. While this may not seem beneficial, it is. There are times when reality is nothing but pain, and to escape that pain the mind must leave reality behind. Last is the door of death. The final resort. Nothing can hurt us after we are dead, or so we have been told.”
25.name: Patrick Rothfuss, The Name of the Wind

26.quote: “A common mistake that people make when trying to design something completely foolproof is to underestimate the ingenuity of complete fools.”
26.name: Douglas Adams, Mostly Harmless

27.quote: “I've found that there is always some beauty left -- in nature, sunshine, freedom, in yourself; these can all help you.”
27.name: Anne Frank, The Diary of a Young Girl

28.quote: “The most common way people give up their power is by thinking they don't have any.”
28.name: Alice Walker

29.quote: “You can cut all the flowers but you cannot keep Spring from coming.”
29.name: Pablo Neruda

0.quote: “A DEFINITION NOT FOUNDIN THE DICTIONARYNot leaving: an act of trust and love,often deciphered by children”
0.name: Markus Zusak, The Book Thief

1.quote: “Dogs never bite me. Just humans.”
1.name: Marilyn Monroe

2.quote: “I cannot sleep unless I am surrounded by books.”
2.name: Jorge Luis Borges

3.quote: “I'm not going to wear a red dress," she said."It would look stunning, My Lady," she called.She spoke to the bubbles gathered on the surface of the water. "If there's anyone I wish to stun at dinner, I'll hit him in the face.”
3.name: Kristin Cashore, Graceling

4.quote: “I have absolutely no pleasure in the stimulants in which I sometimes so madly indulge. It has not been in the pursuit of pleasure that I have periled life and reputation and reason. It has been the desperate attempt to escape from torturing memories, from a sense of insupportable loneliness and a dread of some strange impending doom.”
4.name: Edgar Allan Poe

5.quote: “A writer is someone for whom writing is more difficult than it is for other people.”
5.name: Thomas Mann, Essays of Three Decades

6.quote: “Every one of us is, in the cosmic perspective, precious. If a human disagrees with you, let him live. In a hundred billion galaxies, you will not find another.”
6.name: Carl Sagan, Cosmos

7.quote: “It's funny how humans can wrap their mind around things and fit them into their version of reality.”
7.name: Rick Riordan, The Lightning Thief

8.quote: “It was, he thought, the difference between being dragged into the arena to face a battle to the death and walking into the arena with your head held high. Some people, perhaps, would say that there was little to choose between the two ways, but Dumbledore knew - and so do I, thought Harry, with a rush of fierce pride, and so did my parents - that there was all the difference in the world.”
8.name: J.K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

9.quote: “It is my belief... that the truth is generally preferable to lies.”
9.name: J.K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire

10.quote: “There is a sacredness in tears....They are the messengers of overwhelming grief, of deep contrition and of unspeakable love.”
10.name: Washington Irving

11.quote: “I'm tough, I'm ambitious, and I know exactly what I want. If that makes me a bitch, okay.”
11.name: Madonna

12.quote: “I think there's just one kind of folks. Folks.”
12.name: Harper Lee, To Kill a Mockingbird

13.quote: “Sometimes when I'm talking, my words can't keep up with my thoughts. I wonder why we think faster than we speak. Probably so we can think twice.”
13.name: Bill Watterson

14.quote: “Much of my life had been devoted to trying not to cry in front of people who loved me, so I knew what Augustus was doing. You clench your teeth. You look up. You tell yourself that if they see you cry, it will hurt them, and you will be nothing but a Sadness in their lives, and you must not become a mere sadness, so you will not cry, and you say all of this to yourself while looking up at the ceiling, and then you swallow even though your throat does not want to close and you look at the person who loves you and smile.”
14.name: John Green, The Fault in Our Stars

15.quote: “Stay gold, Ponyboy. Stay gold . . .”
15.name: e pillow seemed to sink a little, and Johnny died.” ― S.E. Hinton, The Outsiders

16.quote: “You can't depend on your eyes when your imagination is out of focus.”
16.name: Mark Twain, A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur's Court

17.quote: “Success is stumbling from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.”
17.name: Winston S. Churchill

18.quote: “Better to be strong than pretty and useless.”
18.name: Lilith Saintcrow, Strange Angels

19.quote: “أتمنى أن أبكي و أرتجف , التصق بواحد من الكبار , لكن الحقيقة القاسية هي أنك الكبار! .. أنت من يجب أن يمنح القوة و الأمن للآخرين!”
19.name: أحمد خالد توفيق

20.quote: “You will find that it is necessary to let things go; simply for the reason that they are heavy. So let them go, let go of them. I tie no weights to my ankles.”
20.name: C. JoyBell C.

21.quote: “The capacity for friendship is God's way of apologizing for our families.”
21.name: Jay McInerney, The Last of the Savages

22.quote: “Do I contradict myself?Very well then I contradict myself,(I am large, I contain multitudes.)”
22.name: Walt Whitman, Leaves of Grass

23.quote: “I loved you like a man loves a woman he never touches, only writes to, keeps little photographs of.”
23.name: Charles Bukowski, Love Is a Dog from Hell

24.quote: “If you pick up a starving dog and make him prosperous he will not bite you. This is the principal difference between a dog and man.”
24.name: Mark Twain

25.quote: “I am trying here to prevent anyone saying the really foolish thing that people often say about Him: I’m ready to accept Jesus as a great moral teacher, but I don’t accept his claim to be God. That is the one thing we must not say. A man who was merely a man and said the sort of things Jesus said would not be a great moral teacher. He would either be a lunatic — on the level with the man who says he is a poached egg — or else he would be the Devil of Hell. You must make your choice. Either this man was, and is, the Son of God, or else a madman or something worse. You can shut him up for a fool, you can spit at him and kill him as a demon or you can fall at his feet and call him Lord and God, but let us not come with any patronizing nonsense about his being a great human teacher. He has not left that open to us. He did not intend to.”
25.name: C.S. Lewis, Mere Christianity

26.quote: “Sometimes when I look at you, I feel I'm gazing at a distant star. It's dazzling, but the light is from tens of thousands of years ago.Maybe the star doesn't even exist any more. Yet sometimes that light seems more real to me than anything.”
26.name: Haruki Murakami, South of the Border, West of the Sun

27.quote: “From the moment I picked up your book until I put it down, I was convulsed with laughter. Some day I intend reading it.”
27.name: Groucho Marx

28.quote: “We both have war inside us. Sometimes it keeps us alive. Sometimes it threatens to destroy us.”
28.name: Veronica Roth, Insurgent

29.quote: “The clearest way into the Universe is through a forest wilderness.”
29.name: John Muir

0.quote: “You endure what is unbearable, and you bear it. That is all.”
0.name: Cassandra Clare, Clockwork Princess

1.quote: “Real loneliness is not necessarily limited to when you are alone.”
1.name: Charles Bukowski

2.quote: “Out of suffering have emerged the strongest souls; the most massive characters are seared with scars.”
2.name: Kahlil Gibran

3.quote: “I've been homesick for countries I've never been, and longed to be where I couldn't be.”
3.name: John Cheever

4.quote: “A learning experience is one of those things that says, 'You know that thing you just did? Don't do that.”
4.name: Douglas Adams, The Salmon of Doubt

5.quote: “A truth that's told with bad intentBeats all the lies you can invent.”
5.name: William Blake, Auguries of Innocence

6.quote: “Maybe everyone can live beyond what they're capable of.”
6.name: Markus Zusak, I Am the Messenger

7.quote: “People can lose their lives in libraries. They ought to be warned.”
7.name: Saul Bellow

8.quote: “If I cannot be better than them, I will become so much worse.”
8.name: Holly Black, The Cruel Prince

9.quote: “Behind every exquisite thing that existed, there was something tragic.”
9.name: Oscar Wilde, The Picture of Dorian Gray

10.quote: “Don't Gain The World & Lose Your Soul, Wisdom Is Better Than Silver Or Gold.”
10.name: Bob Marley

11.quote: “Ah! There is nothing like staying at home, for real comfort.”
11.name: Jane Austen

12.quote: “But who can say what's best? That's why you need to grab whatever chance you have of happiness where you find it, and not worry about other people too much. My experience tells me that we get no more than two or three such chances in a life time, and if we let them go, we regret it for the rest of our lives.”
12.name: Haruki Murakami, Norwegian Wood

13.quote: “Is it so bad, then, to be misunderstood? Pythagoras was misunderstood, and Socrates, and Jesus, and Luther, and Copernicus, and Galileo, and Newton, and every pure and wise spirit that ever took flesh. To be great is to be misunderstood.”
13.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson, Self Reliance

14.quote: “The one thing we can never get enough of is love. And the one thing we never give enough of is love.”
14.name: Henry Miller

15.quote: “Anyway, I keep picturing all these little kids playing some game in this big field of rye and all. Thousands of little kids, and nobody's around - nobody big, I mean - except me. And I'm standing on the edge of some crazy cliff. What I have to do, I have to catch everybody if they start to go over the cliff - I mean if they're running and they don't look where they're going I have to come out from somewhere and catch them. That's all I do all day. I'd just be the catcher in the rye and all. I know it's crazy, but that's the only thing I'd really like to be.”
15.name: J. D. Salinger, The Catcher in the Rye

16.quote: “Stuff your eyes with wonder, he said, live as if you'd drop dead in ten seconds. See the world. It's more fantastic than any dream made or paid for in factories.”
16.name: Ray Bradbury, Fahrenheit 451

17.quote: “It's like Tolstoy said. Happiness is an allegory, unhappiness a story.”
17.name: Haruki Murakami, Kafka on the Shore

18.quote: “You only get one life. It's actually your duty to live it as fully as possible.”
18.name: Jojo Moyes, Me Before You

19.quote: “Yesterday is gone. Tomorrow has not yet come. We have only today. Let us begin.”
19.name: Mother Theresa

20.quote: “Of all the trees we could've hit, we had to get one that hits back.”
20.name: J.K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

21.quote: “Our story has three parts: a beginning, a middle, and an end. And although this is the way all stories unfold, I still can't believe that ours didn't go on forever.”
21.name: Nicholas Sparks, Dear John

22.quote: “Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens”
22.name: Jimi Hendrix

23.quote: “Cruelty does not make a person dishonest, the same way bravery does not make a person kind.”
23.name: Veronica Roth, Insurgent

24.quote: “Love the life you live.Live the life you love.”
24.name: Bob Marley

25.quote: “Would it save you a lot of time if I just gave up and went mad now?”
25.name: Douglas Adams, The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

26.quote: “Raise your words, not voice. It is rain that grows flowers, not thunder.”
26.name: Rumi

27.quote: “Even if you are on the right track, you’ll get run over if you just sit there.”
27.name: Will Rogers

28.quote: “You realize that our mistrust of the future makes it hard to give up the past.”
28.name: Chuck Palahniuk, Survivor

29.quote: “Do you want to know who you are? Don't ask. Act! Action will delineate and define you.”
29.name: Thomas Jefferson

0.quote: “We do not grow absolutely, chronologically. We grow sometimes in one dimension, and not in another; unevenly. We grow partially. We are relative. We are mature in one realm, childish in another. The past, present, and future mingle and pull us backward, forward, or fix us in the present. We are made up of layers, cells, constellations.”
0.name: Anais Nin

1.quote: “Let's think the unthinkable, let's do the undoable. Let us prepare to grapple with the ineffable itself, and see if we may not eff it after all.”
1.name: Douglas Adams, Dirk Gently's Holistic Detective Agency

2.quote: “Great minds are always feared by lesser minds.”
2.name: Dan Brown, The Lost Symbol

3.quote: “And he took her in his arms and kissed her under the sunlit sky, and he cared not that they stood high upon the walls in the sight of many.”
3.name: J.R.R. Tolkien

4.quote: “The only way that we can live, is if we grow. The only way that we can grow is if we change. The only way that we can change is if we learn. The only way we can learn is if we are exposed. And the only way that we can become exposed is if we throw ourselves out into the open. Do it. Throw yourself.”
4.name: C. JoyBell C.

5.quote: “Science and religion are not at odds. Science is simply too young to understand.”
5.name: Dan Brown, Angels & Demons

6.quote: “It's amazing how a little tomorrow can make up for a whole lot of yesterday.”
6.name: John Guare, Landscape of the Body

7.quote: “It's discouraging to think how many people are shocked by honesty and how few by deceit.”
7.name: Noël Coward, Blithe Spirit

8.quote: “Don't tell me," Jace said, "Simon's turned himself into an ocelot and you want me to do something about it before Isabelle makes him into a stole. Well, you'll have have to wait till tomorrow. I'm out of commission." He pointed at himself - he was wearing blue pajamas with a hole in the sleeve. "Look. Jammies.""Jace," Clary said, "this is important.""Don't tell me," he said. "You've got a drawing emergency. You need a nude model. Well, I'm not in the mood. You could always ask Hodge," he said as an afterthought. "I hear he'll do anything for a -""JACE!" she interrupted him, her voice rising to a scream. "JUST SHUT UP FOR A SECOND AND LISTEN, WILL YOU?”
8.name: Cassandra Clare, City of Bones

9.quote: “I am too fond of reading books to care to write them.”
9.name: Oscar Wilde, The Picture of Dorian Gray

10.quote: “Three may keep a secret, if two of them are dead.”
10.name: Benjamin Franklin, Poor Richard's Almanack

11.quote: “My Best Friend is a person who will give me a book I have not read.”
11.name: Abraham Lincoln

12.quote: “The snake which cannot cast its skin has to die. As well the minds which are prevented from changing their opinions; they cease to be mind.”
12.name: Friedrich Nietzsche

13.quote: “Men are afraid that women will laugh at them. Women are afraid that men will kill them.”
13.name: Margaret Atwood

14.quote: “I have come to accept the feeling of not knowing where I am going. And I have trained myself to love it. Because it is only when we are suspended in mid-air with no landing in sight, that we force our wings to unravel and alas begin our flight. And as we fly, we still may not know where we are going to. But the miracle is in the unfolding of the wings. You may not know where you're going, but you know that so long as you spread your wings, the winds will carry you.”
14.name: C. JoyBell C.

15.quote: “The best portion of a good man's life: his little, nameless unremembered acts of kindness and love.”
15.name: William Wordsworth, Lyrical Ballads

16.quote: “Music expresses that which cannot be said and on which it is impossible to be silent.”
16.name: Victor Hugo, William Shakespeare

17.quote: “A purpose of human life, no matter who is controlling it, is to love whoever is around to be loved.”
17.name: Kurt Vonnegut, The Sirens of Titan

18.quote: “Sometimes it's a form of love just to talk to somebody that you have nothing in common with and still be fascinated by their presence.”
18.name: David Byrne

19.quote: “Anyone who falls in love is searching for the missing pieces of themselves. So anyone who's in love gets sad when they think of their lover. It's like stepping back inside a room you have fond memories of, one you haven't seen in a long time.”
19.name: Murakami, Haruki

20.quote: “Beauty is only skin deep, but ugly goes clean to the bone.”
20.name: Dorothy Parker

21.quote: “You gave me a forever within the numbered days, and I'm grateful.”
21.name: John Green, The Fault in Our Stars

22.quote: “I think we ought to read only the kind of books that wound or stab us. If the book we're reading doesn't wake us up with a blow to the head, what are we reading for? So that it will make us happy, as you write? Good Lord, we would be happy precisely if we had no books, and the kind of books that make us happy are the kind we could write ourselves if we had to. But we need books that affect us like a disaster, that grieve us deeply, like the death of someone we loved more than ourselves, like being banished into forests far from everyone, like a suicide. A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us. That is my belief.”
22.name: Franz Kafka

23.quote: “She seems so cool, so focused, so quiet, yet her eyes remain fixed upon the horizon. You think you know all there is to know about her immediately upon meeting her, but everything you think you know is wrong. Passion flows through her like a river of blood. She only looked away for a moment, and the mask slipped, and you fell. All your tomorrows start here.”
23.name: Neil Gaiman, Fragile Things: Short Fictions and Wonders

24.quote: “Art and love are the same thing: It’s the process of seeing yourself in things that are not you.”
24.name: Chuck Klosterman, Killing Yourself to Live: 85% of a True Story

25.quote: “Still round the corner there may wait A new road or a secret gateAnd though I oft have passed them by A day will come at last when IShall take the hidden paths that run West of the Moon, East of the Sun.”
25.name: J.R.R. Tolkien

26.quote: “There is only one thing in the world worse than being talked about, and that is not being talked about.”
26.name: Oscar Wilde, The Picture of Dorian Gray

27.quote: “A woman without a man is like a fish without a bicycle.”
27.name: Irina Dunn

28.quote: “Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves.”
28.name: Carl Gustav Jung

29.quote: “I knew the second I met youthat there was something about you I needed. Turns out it wasn’t something about you at all. It was just you.”
29.name: Jamie McGuire, Beautiful Disaster

0.quote: “It's possible to go on, no matter how impossible it seems, and that in time, the grief . . . lessens. It may not go away completely, but after a while it's not so overwhelming.”
0.name: Nicholas Sparks, Dear John

1.quote: “being alone never felt right. sometimes it felt good, but it never felt right.”
1.name: Charles Bukowski, Women

2.quote: “It is thanks to my evening reading alone that I am still more or less sane.”
2.name: W.G. Sebald, Vertigo

3.quote: “You cannot pick and choose what parts of her to love.”
3.name: Sarah J. Maas, Heir of Fire

4.quote: “Every now and then I like to do as I'm told, just to confuse people.”
4.name: Tamora Pierce, Melting Stones

5.quote: “Fools talk, cowards are silent, wise men listen.”
5.name: Carlos Ruiz Zafon, The Shadow of the Wind

6.quote: “Winter is coming.”
6.name: George R.R. Martin, A Game of Thrones

7.quote: “If you hate a person, you hate something in him that is part of yourself. What isn't part of ourselves doesn't disturb us.”
7.name: Hermann Hesse, Demian: Die Geschichte von Emil Sinclairs Jugend

8.quote: “Lighthouses don’t go running all over an island looking for boats to save; they just stand there shining.”
8.name: Anne Lamott

9.quote: “This is what you shall do; Love the earth and sun and the animals, despise riches, give alms to every one that asks, stand up for the stupid and crazy, devote your income and labor to others, hate tyrants, argue not concerning God, have patience and indulgence toward the people, take off your hat to nothing known or unknown or to any man or number of men, go freely with powerful uneducated persons and with the young and with the mothers of families, read these leaves in the open air every season of every year of your life, re-examine all you have been told at school or church or in any book, dismiss whatever insults your own soul, and your very flesh shall be a great poem and have the richest fluency not only in its words but in the silent lines of its lips and face and between the lashes of your eyes and in every motion and joint of your body.”
9.name: Walt Whitman

10.quote: “I believe a strong woman may be stronger than a man, particularly if she happens to have love in her heart. I guess a loving woman is indestructible.”
10.name: John Steinbeck, East of Eden

11.quote: “I had already found that it was not good to be alone, and so made companionship with what there was around me, sometimes with the universe and sometimes with my own insignificant self; but my books were always my friends, let fail all else.”
11.name: Joshua Slocum, Sailing Alone around the World

12.quote: “Don't be so humble - you are not that great.”
12.name: Golda Meir

13.quote: “I am constantly torn between killing myself and killing everyone around me.”
13.name: David Levithan, Will Grayson, Will Grayson

14.quote: “My imagination functions much better when I don't have to speak to people.”
14.name: Patricia Highsmith

15.quote: “There are books of which the backs and covers are by far the best parts.”
15.name: Charles Dickens, Oliver Twist

16.quote: “I was wise enough never to grow up, while fooling people into believing I had.”
16.name: Margaret Mead

17.quote: “If I had a world of my own, everything would be nonsense. Nothing would be what it is, because everything would be what it isn't. And contrary wise, what is, it wouldn't be. And what it wouldn't be, it would. You see?”
17.name: Lewis Carroll, Alice's Adventures in Wonderland / Through the Looking-Glass

18.quote: “There is no such thing as bad people. We’re all just people who sometimes do bad things.”
18.name: Colleen Hoover, It Ends with Us

19.quote: “Never give up... No one knows what's going to happen next.”
19.name: L. Frank Baum

20.quote: “What you do makes a difference, and you have to decide what kind of difference you want to make.”
20.name: Jane Goodall

21.quote: “If you don't read the newspaper, you're uninformed. If you read the newspaper, you're mis-informed.”
21.name: Mark Twain

22.quote: “May the forces of evil become confused on the way to your house.”
22.name: George Carlin

23.quote: “I am looking for friends. What does that mean -- tame?""It is an act too often neglected," said the fox. "It means to establish ties." "To establish ties?" "Just that," said the fox. "To me, you are still nothing more than a little boy who is just like a hundred thousand other little boys. And I have no need of you. And you, on your part, have no need of me. To you I am nothing more than a fox like a hundred thousand other foxes. But if you tame me, then we shall need each other. To me, you will be unique in all the world. To you, I shall be unique in all the world....”
23.name: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry, The Little Prince

24.quote: “It is easier to forgive an enemy than to forgive a friend.”
24.name: William Blake

25.quote: “Respect was invented to cover the empty place where love should be.”
25.name: Leo Tolstoy, Anna Karenina

26.quote: “The worst part of success is trying to find someone who is happy for you.”
26.name: Bette Midler

27.quote: “Today was good. Today was fun. Tomorrow is another one.”
27.name: Dr. Seuss

28.quote: “He was my mum and dad's best friend. He's a convicted murderer, but he's broken out of wizard prison and he's on the run. He likes to keep in touch with me, though...keep up with my news...check if I'm happy...”
28.name: J.K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban

29.quote: “Maybe there is a beast… maybe it's only us.”
29.name: William Golding, Lord of the Flies

0.quote: “A good book is an event in my life.”
0.name: Stendhal, The Red and the Black

1.quote: “One day you will kiss a man you can't breathe without, and find that breath is of little consequence.”
1.name: Karen Marie Moning, Bloodfever

2.quote: “Everything we hear is an opinion, not a fact. Everything we see is a perspective, not the truth.”
2.name: Marcus Aurelius , Meditations

3.quote: “When everyone knows you’re a monster, you needn’t waste time doing every monstrous thing.”
3.name: Leigh Bardugo, Six of Crows

4.quote: “Yes, frosting. The final defense of the dying.”
4.name: Suzanne Collins, The Hunger Games

5.quote: “People who deny the existence of dragons are often eaten by dragons. From within.”
5.name: Ursula K. Le Guin, The Wave in the Mind: Talks and Essays on the Writer, the Reader and the Imagination

6.quote: “I like good strong words that mean something…”
6.name: Louisa May Alcott, Little Women

7.quote: “!لك شيء في هذا العالم.. فقم”
7.name: غسان كنفاني

8.quote: “I meant," said Ipslore bitterly, "what is there in this world that truly makes living worthwhile?"Death thought about it.CATS, he said eventually. CATS ARE NICE.”
8.name: Terry Pratchett, Sourcery

9.quote: “Peeta, you said at the interview you’d had a crush on me forever. When did forever start?Oh, let’s see. I guess the first day of school. We were five. You had on a red plaid dress and your hair...it was in two braids instead of one. My father pointed you out when we were waiting to line up."Your father? Why?"He said, ‘See that little girl? I wanted to marry her mother, but she ran off with a coal miner.'"What? You’re making that up!"No, true story. And I said, 'A coal miner? Why did she want a coal miner if she could’ve had you?' And he said, 'Because when he sings...even the birds stop to listen.”
9.name: Suzanne Collins, The Hunger Games

10.quote: “If I'd observed all the rules I'd never have got anywhere.”
10.name: Marilyn Monroe

11.quote: “There ain't no sin and there ain't no virtue. There's just stuff people do.”
11.name: John Steinbeck, The Grapes of Wrath

12.quote: “What are all these?" Clary asked."Vials of holy water, blessed knives, steel and silver blades," Jace said, piling the weapons on the floor beside him, "electrum wire - not much use at the moment but it's always good to have spares - silver bullets, charms of protetion, crucifixes, stars of David-""Jesus," said Clary"I doubt he'd fit.""Jace." Clary was appalled.”
12.name: Cassandra Clare, City of Bones

13.quote: “A dream you dream alone is only a dream. A dream you dream together is reality.”
13.name: John Lennon

14.quote: “Kindred spirits are not so scarce as I used to think. It's splendid to find out there are so many of them in the world.”
14.name: L.M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables

15.quote: “Promise me you'll never forget me because if I thought you would, I'd never leave.”
15.name: A.A. Milne

16.quote: “If things start happening, don't worry, don't stew, just go right along and you'll start happening too.”
16.name: Dr. Seuss

17.quote: “Wisdom comes from experience. Experience is often a result of lack of wisdom.”
17.name: Terry Pratchett

18.quote: “Once you had put the pieces back together, even though you may look intact, you were never quite the same as you'd been before the fall.”
18.name: Jodi Picoult

19.quote: “Trying to define yourself is like trying to bite your own teeth.”
19.name: Alan Watts

20.quote: “let me live, love, and say it well in good sentences”
20.name: Sylvia Plath, The Unabridged Journals of Sylvia Plath

21.quote: “Isn't it enough to see that a garden is beautiful without having to believe that there are fairies at the bottom of it too?”
21.name: Douglas Adams, The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

22.quote: “Make your own Bible. Select and collect all the words and sentences that in all your readings have been to you like the blast of a trumpet.”
22.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

23.quote: “Did you know that for pretty much the entire history of the human species, the average life span was less than thirty years? You could count on ten years or so of real adulthood, right? There was no planning for retirement, There was no planning for a career. There was no planning. No time for plannning. No time for a future. But then the life spans started getting longer, and people started having more and more future. And now life has become the future. Every moment of your life is lived for the future--you go to high school so you can go to college so you can get a good job so you can get a nice house so you can afford to send your kids to college so they can get a good job so they can get a nice house so they can afford to send their kids to college.”
23.name: John Green, Paper Towns

24.quote: “I am not afraid of storms, for I am learning how to sail my ship.”
24.name: Louisa May Alcott, Little Women

25.quote: “People worry about kids playing with guns, and teenagers watching violent videos; we are scared that some sort of culture of violence will take them over. Nobody worries about kids listening to thousands - literally thousands - of songs about broken hearts and rejection and pain and misery and loss.”
25.name: Nick Hornby, High Fidelity

26.quote: “No one knows for certain how much impact they have on the lives of other people. Oftentimes, we have no clue. Yet we push it just the same.”
26.name: Jay Asher, Thirteen Reasons Why

27.quote: “He was going to live forever, or die in the attempt.”
27.name: Joseph Heller, Catch-

28.quote: “I fell in love with you, smartass, because you were one of us—because you weren’t afraid of me, and you decided to end your spectacular victory by throwing that piece of bone at Amarantha like a javelin. I felt Cassian’s spirit beside me in that moment, and could have sworn I heard him say, ‘If you don’t marry her, you stupid prick, I will.”
28.name: Sarah J. Maas, A Court of Mist and Fury

29.quote: “Do not go gentle into that good night.Rage, rage against the dying of the light.”
29.name: Dylan Thomas, In Country Sleep, and Other Poems

0.quote: “Pain insists upon being attended to. God whispers to us in our pleasures, speaks in our consciences, but shouts in our pains. It is his megaphone to rouse a deaf world.”
0.name: C.S. Lewis

1.quote: “Tess, Tess, Tessa. Was there ever a more beautiful sound than your name? To speak it aloud makes my heart ring like a bell. Strange to imagine that, isn’t it – a heart ringing – but when you touch me that is what it is like: as if my heart is ringing in my chest and the sound shivers down my veins and splinters my bones with joy.Why have I written these words in this book? Because of you. You taught me to love this book where I had scorned it. When I read it for the second time, with an open mind and heart, I felt the most complete despair and envy of Sydney Carton. Yes, Sydney, for even if he had no hope that the woman he loved would love him, at least he could tell her of his love. At least he could do something to prove his passion, even if that thing was to die.I would have chosen death for a chance to tell you the truth, Tessa, if I could have been assured that death would be my own. And that is why I envied Sydney, for he was free.And now at last I am free, and I can finally tell you, without fear of danger to you, all that I feel in my heart.You are not the last dream of my soul.You are the first dream, the only dream I ever was unable to stop myself from dreaming. You are the first dream of my soul, and from that dream I hope will come all other dreams, a lifetime’s worth.With hope at least,Will Herondale”
1.name: Cassandra Clare, Clockwork Prince

2.quote: “Don't wait for a light to appear at the end of the tunnel, stride down there and light the bloody thing yourself.”
2.name: Sara Henderson

3.quote: “Creativity is intelligence having fun.”
3.name: Albert Einstein

4.quote: “I'm not sentimental--I'm as romantic as you are. The idea, you know,is that the sentimental person thinks things will last--the romanticperson has a desperate confidence that they won't.”
4.name: F. Scott Fitzgerald, This Side of Paradise

5.quote: “The world is a dangerous place to live, not because of the people who are evil, but because of the people who don't do anything about it.”
5.name: Albert Einstein

6.quote: “To love oneself is the beginning of a lifelong romance.”
6.name: Oscar Wilde, An Ideal Husband

7.quote: “Yes, I was infatuated with you: I am still. No one has ever heightened such a keen capacity of physical sensation in me. I cut you out because I couldn't stand being a passing fancy. Before I give my body, I must give my thoughts, my mind, my dreams. And you weren't having any of those.”
7.name: Sylvia Plath, The Unabridged Journals of Sylvia Plath

8.quote: “Your beliefs become your thoughts, Your thoughts become your words, Your words become your actions, Your actions become your habits, Your habits become your values, Your values become your destiny.”
8.name: Gandhi

9.quote: “I'm oxygen and he's dying to breathe.”
9.name: Tahereh Mafi, Shatter Me

10.quote: “Most books on witchcraft will tell you that witches work naked. This is because most books on witchcraft were written by men.”
10.name: Neil Gaiman

11.quote: “My tongue will tell the anger of my heart, or else my heart concealing it will break.”
11.name: William Shakespeare, The Taming of the Shrew

12.quote: “You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection.”
12.name: Sharon Salzberg

13.quote: “You possess other people's...bodies."He accepted that statement with a nod."Do you want to possess my body?""I want to do a lot of things to your body, but that's not one of them.”
13.name: Becca Fitzpatrick, Hush, Hush

14.quote: “She leaned down and looked at his lifeless face and Leisel kissed her best friend, Rudy Steiner, soft and true on his lips. He tasted dusty and sweet. He tasted like regret in the shadows of trees and in the glow of the anarchist's suit collection. She kissed him long and soft, and when she pulled herself away, she touched his mouth with her fingers...She did not say goodbye. She was incapable, and after a few more minutes at his side, she was able to tear herself from the ground. It amazes me what humans can do, even when streams are flowing down their faces and they stagger on...”
14.name: Markus Zusak, The Book Thief

15.quote: “It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.”
15.name: Confucius

16.quote: “For whatever we lose (like a you or a me),It's always our self we find in the sea.”
16.name: e.e. cummings, 100 Selected Poems

17.quote: “For what it’s worth: it’s never too late or, in my case, too early to be whoever you want to be. There’s no time limit, stop whenever you want. You can change or stay the same, there are no rules to this thing. We can make the best or the worst of it. I hope you make the best of it. And I hope you see things that startle you. I hope you feel things you never felt before. I hope you meet people with a different point of view. I hope you live a life you’re proud of. If you find that you’re not, I hope you have the courage to start all over again.”
17.name: Eric Roth, The Curious Case of Benjamin Button Screenplay

18.quote: “And I asked myself about the present: how wide it was, how deep it was, how much was mine to keep.”
18.name: Kurt Vonnegut, Slaughterhouse-Five

19.quote: “You're alive only once, as far as we know, and what could be worse than getting to the end of your life and realizing you hadn't lived it?”
19.name: Edward Albee

20.quote: “If neurotic is wanting two mutually exclusive things at one and the same time, then I'm neurotic as hell. I'll be flying back and forth between one mutually exclusive thing and another for the rest of my days.”
20.name: Sylvia Plath, The Bell Jar

21.quote: “No matter what he does, every person on earth plays a central role in the history of the world. And normally he doesn't know it.”
21.name: Paulo Coelho, The Alchemist

22.quote: “Who in the world am I? Ah, that's the great puzzle.”
22.name: Lewis Carroll , Alice in Wonderland

23.quote: “I didn’t need you, you idiot. I picked you. And then you picked me back.”
23.name: John Green, Paper Towns

24.quote: “In the beginning there was nothing, which exploded.”
24.name: Terry Pratchett, Lords and Ladies

25.quote: “Love is the absence of judgment.”
25.name: Dalai Lama XIV

26.quote: “My soul is from elsewhere, I'm sure of that, and I intend to end up there.”
26.name: Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi

27.quote: “There are some things you can't share without ending up liking each other, and knocking out a twelve-foot mountain troll is one of them.”
27.name: J. K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone

28.quote: “The library is inhabited by spirits that come out of the pages at night.”
28.name: Isabel Allende

29.quote: “Light thinks it travels faster than anything but it is wrong. No matter how fast light travels, it finds the darkness has always got there first, and is waiting for it.”
29.name: Terry Pratchett, Reaper Man

0.quote: “It is absurd to divide people into good and bad. People are either charming or tedious.”
0.name: Oscar Wilde, Lady Windermere's Fan

1.quote: “I wanted a perfect ending. Now I've learned, the hard way, that some poems don't rhyme, and some stories don't have a clear beginning, middle, and end.”
1.name: Gilda Radner

2.quote: “Never underestimate the power of stupid people in large groups.”
2.name: George Carlin

3.quote: “I knew, in the silence that followed, that anything could happen here. It might be too late: again, I might have missed my chance. But I would at least know I tried, that I took my heart and extended my hand, whatever the outcome."Okay," he said. He took a breath. "What would you do, if you could do anything?"I took a step toward him, closing the space between us. "This," I said. And then I kissed him.”
3.name: Sarah Dessen, The Truth About Forever

4.quote: “Believe nothing you hear, and only one half that you see.”
4.name: Edgar Allan Poe

5.quote: “In a way, it's nice to know that there are Greek gods out there, because you have somebody to blame when things go wrong. For instance, when you're walking away from a bus that's just been attacked by monster hags and blown up by lightning, and it's raining on top of everything else, most people might think that's just really bad luck; when you're a half-blood, you understand that some devine force is really trying to mess up your day.”
5.name: Rick Riordan, The Titan's Curse

6.quote: “When he died, all things soft and beautiful and bright would be buried with him.”
6.name: Madeline Miller, The Song of Achilles

7.quote: “You think my first instinct is to protect you. Because you're small, or a girl, or a Stiff. But you're wrong."He leans his face close to mine and wraps his fingers around my chin. His hand smells like metal. When was the last time he held a gun, or a knife? My skin tingles at the point of contact, like he's transmitting electricity through his skin. "My first instinct is to push you until you break, just to see how hard I have to press." he says, his fingers squeezing at the word break. My body tenses at the edge in his voice, so I am coiled as tight as a spring, and I forget to breathe.His dark eyes lifting to mine, he adds, "But I resist it." "Why..." I swallow hard. "Why is that your first instinct?""Fear doesn't shut you down; it wakes you up. I've seen it. It's fascinating." He releases me but doesn't pull away, his hand grazing my jaw, my neck. "Sometimes I just want to see it again. Want to see you awake.”
7.name: Veronica Roth, Divergent

8.quote: “Do not fall in love with people like me. I will take you to museums, and parks, and monuments, and kiss you in every beautiful place, so that you can never go back to them without tasting me like blood in your mouth.I will destroy you in the most beautiful way possible. And when I leave you will finally understand, why storms are named after people.”
8.name: Caitlyn Siehl, Literary Sexts: A Collection of Short & Sexy Love Poems

9.quote: “The world is full of magic things, patiently waiting for our senses to grow sharper.”
9.name: W.B. Yeats

10.quote: “People shouldn't be afraid of their government. Governments should be afraid of their people.”
10.name: Alan Moore, V for Vendetta

11.quote: “So when the moon's only partly full, you only feel a little wolfy?" "You could say that.""Well, you can go ahead and hang your head out the car window if you feel like it.""I'm a werewolf, not a golden retriever.”
11.name: Cassandra Clare

12.quote: “But he who dares not grasp the thorn Should never crave the rose.”
12.name: Anne Bronte

13.quote: “One thing you can't hide - is when you're crippled inside.”
13.name: John Lennon

14.quote: “People have forgotten this truth," the fox said. "But you mustn’t forget it. You become responsible forever for what you’ve tamed. You’re responsible for your rose.”
14.name: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry, The Little Prince

15.quote: “You have to know what you stand for, not just what you stand against.”
15.name: Laurie Halse Anderson, Speak

16.quote: “There is greatness in doing something you hate for the sake of someone you love.”
16.name: Shmuley Boteach

17.quote: “Success makes so many people hate you. I wish it wasn't that way. It would be wonderful to enjoy success without seeing envy in the eyes of those around you.”
17.name: Marilyn Monroe

18.quote: “We can never judge the lives of others, because each person knows only their own pain and renunciation. It's one thing to feel that you are on the right path, but it's another to think that yours is the only path.”
18.name: Paulo Coelho

19.quote: “Then I realize what it is. It's him. Something about him makes me feel like I am about to fall. Or turn to liquid. Or burst into flames.”
19.name: Veronica Roth, Divergent

20.quote: “Always do what is right. It will gratify half of mankind and astound the other.”
20.name: Mark Twain

21.quote: “Keep smiling, because life is a beautiful thing and there's so much to smile about.”
21.name: Marilyn Monroe

22.quote: “She was the heir of ash and fire, and she would bow to no one.”
22.name: Sarah J. Maas, Heir of Fire

23.quote: “Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go.”
23.name: T.S. Eliot

24.quote: “There was another life that I might have had, but I am having this one.”
24.name: Kazuo Ishiguro

25.quote: “The best fantasy is written in the language of dreams. It is alive as dreams are alive, more real than real ... for a moment at least ... that long magic moment before we wake. Fantasy is silver and scarlet, indigo and azure, obsidian veined with gold and lapis lazuli. Reality is plywood and plastic, done up in mud brown and olive drab. Fantasy tastes of habaneros and honey, cinnamon and cloves, rare red meat and wines as sweet as summer. Reality is beans and tofu, and ashes at the end. Reality is the strip malls of Burbank, the smokestacks of Cleveland, a parking garage in Newark. Fantasy is the towers of Minas Tirith, the ancient stones of Gormenghast, the halls of Camelot. Fantasy flies on the wings of Icarus, reality on Southwest Airlines. Why do our dreams become so much smaller when they finally come true? We read fantasy to find the colors again, I think. To taste strong spices and hear the songs the sirens sang. There is something old and true in fantasy that speaks to something deep within us, to the child who dreamt that one day he would hunt the forests of the night, and feast beneath the hollow hills, and find a love to last forever somewhere south of Oz and north of Shangri-La. They can keep their heaven. When I die, I'd sooner go to middle Earth.”
25.name: George R.R. Martin

26.quote: “Our memory is a more perfect world than the universe: it gives back life to those who no longer exist.”
26.name: Guy de Maupassant

27.quote: “Silence make the real conversations between friends. Not the saying, but the never needing to say that counts.”
27.name: Margaret Lee Runbeck

28.quote: “The beauty of a woman is not in the clothes she wears, the figure that she carries, or the way she combs her hair. The beauty of a woman is seen in her eyes, because that is the doorway to her heart, the place where love resides. True beauty in a woman is reflected in her soul. It's the caring that she lovingly gives, the passion that she shows & the beauty of a woman only grows with passing years.”
28.name: Audrey Hepburn

29.quote: “Youth can not know how age thinks and feels. But old men are guilty if they forget what it was to be young.”
29.name: J.K. Rowling , Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix

0.quote: “Only the dead have seen the end of war.”
0.name: Plato

1.quote: “When I had nothing to lose, I had everything. When I stopped being who I am, I found myself.”
1.name: Paulo Coelho, Eleven Minutes

2.quote: “Everyone must leave something behind when he dies, my grandfather said. A child or a book or a painting or a house or a wall built or a pair of shoes made. Or a garden planted. Something your hand touched some way so your soul has somewhere to go when you die, and when people look at that tree or that flower you planted, you're there. It doesn't matter what you do, he said, so long as you change something from the way it was before you touched it into something that's like you after you take your hands away. The difference between the man who just cuts lawns and a real gardener is in the touching, he said. The lawn-cutter might just as well not have been there at all; the gardener will be there a lifetime.”
2.name: Ray Bradbury, Fahrenheit 451

3.quote: “Tell me and I forget, teach me and I may remember, involve me and I learn.”
3.name: Benjamin Franklin

4.quote: “Art enables us to find ourselves and lose ourselves at the same time.”
4.name: Thomas Merton , No Man Is an Island

5.quote: “I wonder if the snow loves the trees and fields, that it kisses them so gently? And then it covers them up snug, you know, with a white quilt; and perhaps it says, "Go to sleep, darlings, till the summer comes again.”
5.name: Lewis Carroll, Alice's Adventures in Wonderland / Through the Looking-Glass

6.quote: “We can know only that we know nothing. And that is the highest degree of human wisdom.”
6.name: Leo Tolstoy, War and Peace

7.quote: “Compassion is the basis of morality.”
7.name: Arthur Schopenhauer

8.quote: “In a time of destruction, create something.”
8.name: Maxine Hong Kingston

9.quote: “I'm saying that I'm a moody, insecure, narrow-minded, jealous, borderline homicidal bitch, and I want you to promise me that you're okay with that, because it's who I am, and you're what I need.”
9.name: Jeaniene Frost, Halfway to the Grave

10.quote: “Keep in mind that people change, but the past doesn't.”
10.name: Becca Fitzpatrick, Hush, Hush

11.quote: “I suppose a fire that burns that bright is not meant to last.”
11.name: Veronica Roth, Allegiant

12.quote: “The creatures outside looked from pig to man, and from man to pig, and from pig to man again; but already it was impossible to say which was which.”
12.name: George Orwell, Animal Farm

13.quote: “They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety.”
13.name: Benjamin Franklin, Memoirs of the life & writings of Benjamin Franklin

14.quote: “Life isn't finding shelter in the storm. It's about learning to dance in the rain.”
14.name: Sherrilyn Kenyon, Acheron

15.quote: “When the heart speaks, the mind finds it indecent to object.”
15.name: Milan Kundera, The Unbearable Lightness of Being

16.quote: “The ships hung in the sky in much the same way that bricks don't.”
16.name: Douglas Adams, The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

17.quote: “The moon is a loyal companion.It never leaves. It’s always there, watching, steadfast, knowing us in our light and dark moments, changing forever just as we do. Every day it’s a different version of itself. Sometimes weak and wan, sometimes strong and full of light. The moon understands what it means to be human.Uncertain. Alone. Cratered by imperfections.”
17.name: Tahereh Mafi, Shatter Me

18.quote: “A child can teach an adult three things: to be happy for no reason, to always be busy with something, and to know how to demand with all his might that which he desires.”
18.name: Paulo Coelho

19.quote: “I am glad you are here with me. Here at the end of all things, Sam.”
19.name: J.R.R. Tolkien, The Return of the King

20.quote: “Your friend's poetry is terrible," he said.Clary blinked, caught momentarily off guard. "What?""I said his poetry was terrible. It sounds like he ate a dictionary and started vomiting up words at random.”
20.name: Cassandra Clare, City of Bones

21.quote: “Never forget what you are, for surely the world will not. Make it your strength. Then it can never be your weakness.”
21.name: George R.R. Martin, A Song of Ice and Fire,

22.quote: “I have learned now that while those who speak about one's miseries usually hurt, those who keep silence hurt more.”
22.name: C. S. Lewis

23.quote: “و كلما أمسكت بحالة من حالاتي و قلت هذا هو أنا .. ما تلبث هذه الحالة أن تفلت من أصابعي و تحل محلها حالة أخرى .. هي أنا .. أيضاً..”
23.name: مصطفى محمود, لغز الموت

24.quote: “Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.”
24.name: Confucious

25.quote: “Books are the carriers of civilization...They are companions, teachers, magicians, bankers of the treasures of the mind. Books are humanity in print.”
25.name: Barbara W. Tuchman

26.quote: “I want to see you.Know your voice.Recognize you when youfirst come 'round the corner.Sense your scent when I come into a room you've just left.Know the lift of your heel,the glide of your foot.Become familiar with the way you purse your lipsthen let them part, just the slightest bit,when I lean in to your spaceand kiss you.I want to know the joy of how you whisper "more”
26.name: Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi

27.quote: “You should never be surprised when someone treats you with respect, you should expect it.”
27.name: Sarah Dessen, Keeping the Moon

28.quote: “Every time you smile at someone, it is an action of love, a gift to that person, a beautiful thing.”
28.name: Mother Teresa

29.quote: “You can have it all. Just not all at once.”
29.name: Oprah Winfrey

0.quote: “Don't feel bad for one moment about doing what brings you joy.”
0.name: Sarah J. Maas, A Court of Thorns and Roses

1.quote: “A girl should be two things: who and what she wants.”
1.name: Coco Chanel, The Gospel According to Coco Chanel: Life Lessons from the World's Most Elegant Woman

2.quote: “DON'T THINK OF IT AS DYING, said Death. JUST THINK OF IT AS LEAVING EARLY TO AVOID THE RUSH.”
2.name: Terry Pratchett, Good Omens: The Nice and Accurate Prophecies of Agnes Nutter, Witch

3.quote: “Books are easily destroyed. But words will live as long as people can remember them.”
3.name: Tahereh Mafi, Unravel Me

4.quote: “My bounty is as boundless as the sea,My love as deep; the more I give to thee,The more I have, for both are infinite.”
4.name: William Shakespeare, Romeo and Juliet

5.quote: “We didn't talk about anything heavy or light. We were just there together. And that was enough”
5.name: Stephen Chbosky, The Perks of Being a Wallflower

6.quote: “Never interrupt your enemy when he is making a mistake.”
6.name: Napoleon Bonaparte

7.quote: “أحسد الأطفال الرضّع، لأنهم يملكون وحدهم حق الصراخ والقدرة عليه، قبل أن تروض الحياة حبالهم الصوتية، وتعلِّمهم الصمت”
7.name: أحلام مستغانمي, ذاكرة الجسد

8.quote: “Must you go? I was rather hoping you'd stay and be a ministering angel, but if you must go, you must.""I'll stay," Will said a bit crossly, and threw himself down in the armchair Tessa had just vacated. "I can minister angelically.""None too convincingly. And you're not as pretty to look at as Tessa is," Jem said, closing his eyes as he leaned back against the pillow."How rude. Many who have gazed upon me have compared the experience to gazing at the radiance of the sun."Jem still had his eyes closed. "If they mean it gives you a headache, they aren't wrong.”
8.name: Cassandra Clare, Clockwork Angel

9.quote: “Confidence is ignorance. If you're feeling cocky, it's because there's something you don't know.”
9.name: Eoin Colfer, Artemis Fowl

10.quote: “Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear - not absence of fear.”
10.name: Mark Twain

11.quote: “The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.”
11.name: Eleanor Roosevelt

12.quote: “I'll just have them change the entry in the demonology textbook from 'almost extinct' to 'not extinct enough for Alec. He prefers his monsters really, really extinct.' Will that make you happy?”
12.name: Cassandra Clare, City of Ashes

13.quote: “A half-read book is a half-finished love affair.”
13.name: David Mitchell, Cloud Atlas

14.quote: “Sonnet XVIII do not love you as if you were salt-rose, or topaz,or the arrow of carnations the fire shoots off.I love you as certain dark things are to be loved,in secret, between the shadow and the soul.I love you as the plant that never bloomsbut carries in itself the light of hidden flowers;thanks to your love a certain solid fragrance,risen from the earth, lives darkly in my body.I love you without knowing how, or when, or from where.I love you straightforwardly, without complexities or pride;so I love you because I know no other way than this: where I does not exist, nor you,so close that your hand on my chest is my hand,so close that your eyes close as I fall asleep. ”
14.name: Pablo Neruda

15.quote: “So please, oh please, we beg, we pray, go throw your TV set away, and in its place you can install, a lovely bookshelf on the wall.”
15.name: Roald Dahl

16.quote: “Lack of direction, not lack of time, is the problem. We all have twenty-four hour days.”
16.name: Zig Ziglar

17.quote: “Remember, remember, this is now, and now, and now. Live it, feel it, cling to it. I want to become acutely aware of all I’ve taken for granted.”
17.name: Sylvia Plath

18.quote: “Nothing in the world is ever completely wrong. Even a stopped clock is right twice a day.”
18.name: Paulo Coelho, Brida

19.quote: “It's all in the view. That's what I mean about forever, too. For any one of us our forever could end in an hour, or a hundred years from now. You never know for sure, so you'd better make every second count.”
19.name: Sarah Dessen, The Truth About Forever

20.quote: “Where there is love, there is often also hate. They can exist side by side.”
20.name: Cassandra Clare, City of Bones

21.quote: “I don't know that love changes. People change. Circumstances change.”
21.name: Nicholas Sparks

22.quote: “Those who know do not speak. Those who speak do not know.”
22.name: Lao Tsu, Tao Teh Ching

23.quote: “A book lying idle on a shelf is wasted ammunition.”
23.name: Henry Miller, The Books in My Life

24.quote: “Quotation is a serviceable substitute for wit.”
24.name: Oscar Wilde

25.quote: “My library is an archive of longings.”
25.name: Susan Sontag, As Consciousness is Harnessed to Flesh: Journals and Notebooks, 1964-1980

26.quote: “It's the questions we can't answer that teach us the most. They teach us how to think. If you give a man an answer, all he gains is a little fact. But give him a question and he'll look for his own answers.”
26.name: Patrick Rothfuss, The Wise Man's Fear

27.quote: “What's the good of living if you don't try a few things?”
27.name: Charles M. Schulz

28.quote: “I will remember the kisses our lips raw with love and how you gave me everything you had and how I offered you what was left of me, and I will remember your small room the feel of you the light in the window your records your books our morning coffee our noons our nights our bodies spilled together sleeping the tiny flowing currents immediate and forever your leg my leg your arm my arm your smile and the warmth of you who made me laugh again.”
28.name: Charles Bukowski

29.quote: “I bet you could sometimes find all the mysteries of the universe in someone's hand.”
29.name: Benjamin Alire Sáenz, Aristotle and Dante Discover the Secrets of the Universe

0.quote: “Have a heart that never hardens, and a temper that never tires, and a touch that never hurts.”
0.name: Charles Dickens

1.quote: “Learn to value yourself, which means: fight for your happiness.”
1.name: Ayn Rand

2.quote: “silence is the language of god, all else is poor translation.”
2.name: Rumi

3.quote: “Trust is like a mirror, you can fix it if it's broken, but you can still see the crack in that mother fucker's reflection.”
3.name: Lady Gaga

4.quote: “A lot of you cared, just not enough.”
4.name: Jay Asher, Thirteen Reasons Why

5.quote: “If you want to keep a secret, you must also hide it from yourself.”
5.name: George Orwell, 1984

6.quote: “When you find your path, you must not be afraid. You need to have sufficient courage to make mistakes. Disappointment, defeat, and despair are the tools God uses to show us the way.”
6.name: Paulo Coelho, Brida

7.quote: “Change will not come if we wait for some other person, or if we wait for some other time. We are the ones we've been waiting for. We are the change that we seek.”
7.name: Barack Obama

8.quote: “Even strength must bow to wisdom sometimes.”
8.name: Rick Riordan, The Lightning Thief

9.quote: “Dreams do come true, if only we wish hard enough. You can have anything in life if you will sacrifice everything else for it.”
9.name: J.M. Barrie, Peter Pan

10.quote: “There is only one sin. and that is theft... when you tell a lie, you steal someones right to the truth.”
10.name: Khaled Hosseini, The Kite Runner

11.quote: “Beautiful face. Beautiful body. Horrible attitude. It was the holy trinity of hot boys.”
11.name: Jennifer L. Armentrout, Obsidian

12.quote: “Tact is the ability to tell someone to go to hell in such a way that they look forward to the trip.”
12.name: Winston Churchill

13.quote: “We need, in love, to practice only this: letting each other go. For holding on comes easily; we do not need to learn it.”
13.name: Rainer Maria Rilke, Translations from the Poetry of Rainer Maria Rilke

14.quote: “Worry never robs tomorrow of its sorrow, but only saps today of its strength.”
14.name: A.J. Cronin

15.quote: “That's why when major badasses greet each other in movies, they don't say anything, they just nod. The nod means, 'I' am a badass, and I recognize that you, too, are a badass,' but they don't say anything because they're Wolverine and Magneto and it would mess up their vibe to explain.”
15.name: Cassandra Clare, City of Bones

16.quote: “Go on with what your heart tells you, or you will lose all.”
16.name: Rick Riordan, The Lightning Thief

17.quote: “Happiness can be found, even in the darkest of times, if one only remembers to turn on the light.”
17.name: J.K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban

18.quote: “The glory of friendship is not the outstretched hand, not the kindly smile, nor the joy of companionship; it is the spiritual inspiration that comes to one when you discover that someone else believes in you and is willing to trust you with a friendship.”
18.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

19.quote: “When I get lonely these days, I think: So BE lonely, Liz. Learn your way around loneliness. Make a map of it. Sit with it, for once in your life. Welcome to the human experience. But never again use another person's body or emotions as a scratching post for your own unfulfilled yearnings.”
19.name: Elizabeth Gilbert, Eat, Pray, Love

20.quote: “And thus the heart will break, yet brokenly live on.”
20.name: George Gordon Byron

21.quote: “Politeness is deception in pretty packaging.”
21.name: Veronica Roth, Divergent

22.quote: “Older men declare war. But it is youth that must fight and die.”
22.name: Herbert Hoover

23.quote: “If you end up with a boring miserable life because you listened to your mom, your dad, your teacher, your priest, or some guy on television telling you how to do your shit, then you deserve it.”
23.name: Frank Zappa

24.quote: “Expose yourself to your deepest fear; after that, fear has no power, and the fear of freedom shrinks and vanishes. You are free.”
24.name: Jim Morrison

25.quote: “Without suffering, there'd be no compassion.”
25.name: Nicholas Sparks, A Walk to Remember

26.quote: “Children begin by loving their parents; as they grow older they judge them; sometimes they forgive them.”
26.name: Oscar Wilde, The Picture of Dorian Gray

27.quote: “But it is the nature of stars to cross, and never was Shakespeare more wrong than when he has Cassius note, ‘The fault, dear Brutus, is not in our stars / But in ourselves.”
27.name: John Green, The Fault in Our Stars

28.quote: “A snowball in the face is surely the perfect beginning to a lasting friendship.”
28.name: Markus Zusak, The Book Thief

29.quote: “All alone! Whether you like it or not, alone is something you'll be quite a lot!”
29.name: Dr. Seuss, Oh, the Places You'll Go! and The Lorax

0.quote: “There is more to sex appeal than just measurements. I don't need a bedroom to prove my womanliness. I can convey just as much sex appeal, picking apples off a tree or standing in the rain.”
0.name: Audrey Hepburn

1.quote: “Lolita, light of my life, fire of my loins. My sin, my soul. Lo-lee-ta: the tip of the tongue taking a trip of three steps down the palate to tap, at three, on the teeth. Lo. Lee. Ta. She was Lo, plain Lo, in the morning, standing four feet ten in one sock. She was Lola in slacks. She was Dolly at school. She was Dolores on the dotted line. But in my arms she was always Lolita. Did she have a precursor? She did, indeed she did. In point of fact, there might have been no Lolita at all had I not loved, one summer, an initial girl-child. In a princedom by the sea. Oh when? About as many years before Lolita was born as my age was that summer. You can always count on a murderer for a fancy prose style. Ladies and gentlemen of the jury, exhibit number one is what the seraphs, the misinformed, simple, noble-winged seraphs, envied. Look at this tangle of thorns.”
1.name: Vladimir Nabokov, Lolita

2.quote: “Dreams like a podcast,Downloading truth in my ears.They tell me cool stuff.""Apollo?" I guess, because I figured nobody else could make a haiku that bad.He put his finger to his lips. "I'm incognito. Call me Fred.""A god named Fred?”
2.name: Rick Riordan

3.quote: “Owners of dogs will have noticed that, if you provide them with food and water and shelter and affection, they will think you are god. Whereas owners of cats are compelled to realize that, if you provide them with food and water and shelter and affection, they draw the conclusion that they are gods.”
3.name: Christopher Hitchens, The Portable Atheist: Essential Readings for the Nonbeliever

4.quote: “Just because you're paranoid doesn't mean they aren't after you.”
4.name: Joseph Heller, Catch-22

5.quote: “You can't stop the futureYou can't rewind the pastThe only way to learn the secret...is to press play.”
5.name: Jay Asher, Thirteen Reasons Why

6.quote: “If you want to know what God thinks of money, just look at the people he gave it to.”
6.name: Dorothy Parker

7.quote: “You won’t understand what I mean now, but someday you will: the only trick of friendship, I think, is to find people who are better than you are—not smarter, not cooler, but kinder, and more generous, and more forgiving—and then to appreciate them for what they can teach you, and to try to listen to them when they tell you something about yourself, no matter how bad—or good—it might be, and to trust them, which is the hardest thing of all. But the best, as well.”
7.name: Hanya Yanagihara, A Little Life

8.quote: “Though my soul may set in darkness, it will rise in perfect light; I have loved the stars too fondly to be fearful of the night.”
8.name: Sarah Williams, Twilight Hours: A Legacy of Verse

9.quote: “The saddest people I've ever met in life are the ones who don't care deeply about anything at all. Passion and satisfaction go hand in hand, and without them, any happiness is only temporary, because there's nothing to make it last.”
9.name: Nicholas Sparks, Dear John

10.quote: “When I was a child, adults would tell me not to make things up, warning me of what would happen if I did. As far as I can tell so far, it seems to involve lots of foreign travel and not having to get up too early in the morning.”
10.name: Neil Gaiman, Smoke and Mirrors: Short Fiction and Illusions

11.quote: “I desire the things that will destroy me in the end.”
11.name: Sylvia Plath, The Unabridged Journals of Sylvia Plath

12.quote: “It wouldn't be my move," Jace agreed. "First the candy and flowers, then the apology letters, then the ravenous demon hordes. In that order.”
12.name: Cassandra Clare, City of Bones

13.quote: “If people refuse to look at you in a new light and they can only see you for what you were, only see you for the mistakes you've made, if they don't realize that you are not your mistakes, then they have to go.”
13.name: Steve Maraboli, Life, the Truth, and Being Free

14.quote: “- "Why don't you like to be touched?" - "Because I'm fifty shades of fucked-up, Anastasia”
14.name: E.L. James, Fifty Shades of Grey

15.quote: “Atheism turns out to be too simple. If the whole universe has no meaning, we should never have found out that it has no meaning...”
15.name: C.S. Lewis

16.quote: “Let our scars fall in love.”
16.name: Galway Kinnell

17.quote: “If conversation was the lyrics, laughter was the music, making time spent together a melody that could be replayed over and over without getting stale.”
17.name: Nicholas Sparks

18.quote: “Kindness is a language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see.”
18.name: Mark Twain

19.quote: “I am made of memories.”
19.name: Madeline Miller, The Song of Achilles

20.quote: “God can't give us peace and happiness apart from Himself because there is no such thing.”
20.name: C.S. Lewis

21.quote: “No persons are more frequently wrong, than those who will not admit they are wrong.”
21.name: François de La Rochefoucauld

22.quote: “Every book, every volume you see here, has a soul. The soul of the person who wrote it and of those who read it and lived and dreamed with it. Every time a book changes hands, every time someone runs his eyes down its pages, its spirit grows and strengthens.”
22.name: Carlos Ruiz Zafón, The Shadow of the Wind

23.quote: “I want to grow old without facelifts. I want to have the courage to be loyal to the face I have made.”
23.name: Marilyn Monroe

24.quote: “The world is indeed comic, but the joke is on mankind.”
24.name: H. P. Lovecraft

25.quote: “Fill your paper with the breathings of your heart.”
25.name: William Wordsworth

26.quote: “Lost opportunities, lost possibilities, feelings we can never get back. That's part of what it means to be alive. But inside our heads - at least that's where I imagine it - there's a little room where we store those memories. A room like the stacks in this library. And to understand the workings of our own heart we have to keep on making new reference cards. We have to dust things off every once in awhile, let in fresh air, change the water in the flower vases. In other words, you'll live forever in your own private library.”
26.name: Haruki Murakami, Kafka on the Shore

27.quote: “We've got to live, no matter how many skies have fallen.”
27.name: D.H. Lawrence, Lady Chatterley's Lover

28.quote: “If you want to find out what a man is to the bottom, give him power. Any man can stand adversity — only a great man can stand prosperity. It is the glory of Abraham Lincoln that he never abused power only on the side of mercy”
28.name: Robert Ingersoll

29.quote: “Don't spend time beating on a wall, hoping to transform it into a door. ”
29.name: Coco Chanel

0.quote: “That which can be asserted without evidence, can be dismissed without evidence.”
0.name: Christopher Hitchens

1.quote: “We take for granted the very things that most deserve our gratitude.”
1.name: Cynthia Ozick

2.quote: “I know I am but summer to your heart, and not the full four seasons of the year.”
2.name: Edna St. Vincent Millay

3.quote: “If there's a single lesson that life teaches us, it's that wishing doesn't make it so.”
3.name: Lev Grossman, The Magicians

4.quote: “Time doesn’t heal emotional pain, you need to learn how to let go.”
4.name: Roy T. Bennett, The Light in the Heart

5.quote: “I must learn to be content with being happier than I deserve.”
5.name: Jane Austen, Pride and Prejudice

6.quote: “Honestly, if you were any slower, you’d be going backward.”
6.name: J.K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

7.quote: “Families are messy. Immortal families are eternally messy. Sometimes the best we can do is to remind each other that we're related for better or for worse...and try to keep the maiming and killing to a minimum.”
7.name: Rick Riordan, The Sea of Monsters

8.quote: “When you spend so long trapped in darkness, Lucien, you find that the darkness begins to stare back.”
8.name: Sarah J. Maas, A Court of Mist and Fury

9.quote: “It is a good rule after reading a new book, never to allow yourself another new one till you have read an old one in between.”
9.name: C.S. Lewis

10.quote: “Here is a lesson in creative writing. First rule: Do not use semicolons. They are transvestite hermaphrodites representing absolutely nothing. All they do is show you've been to college.”
10.name: Kurt Vonnegut, A Man Without a Country

11.quote: “I wish I were a girl again, half-savage and hardy, and free.”
11.name: Emily Brontë, Wuthering Heights

12.quote: “In individuals, insanity is rare; but in groups, parties, nations and epochs, it is the rule.”
12.name: Friedrich Nietzsche

13.quote: “Cry. Forgive. Learn. Move on. Let your tears water the seeds of your future happiness.”
13.name: Steve Maraboli

14.quote: “Illegal aliens have always been a problem in the United States. Ask any Indian.”
14.name: Robert Orben

15.quote: “If you would tell me the heart of a man, tell me not what he reads, but what he rereads.”
15.name: Francois Mauriac

16.quote: “Don’t try to make life a mathematics problem with yourself in the center and everything coming out equal. When you’re good, bad things can still happen. And if you’re bad, you can still be lucky.”
16.name: Barbara Kingsolver, The Poisonwood Bible

17.quote: “I fell in love with him. But I don't just stay with him by default as if there's no one else available to me. I stay with him because I choose to, every day that I wake up, every day that we fight or lie to each other or disappoint each other. I choose him over and over again, and he chooses me.”
17.name: Veronica Roth, Allegiant

18.quote: “It was a mistake," you said. But the cruel thing was, it felt like the mistake was mine, for trusting you.”
18.name: David Levithan, The Lover's Dictionary

19.quote: “Books are not made to be believed, but to be subjected to inquiry. When we consider a book, we mustn't ask ourselves what it says but what it means...”
19.name: Umberto Eco, The Name of the Rose

20.quote: “The trouble is not in dying for a friend, but in finding a friend worth dying for.”
20.name: Mark Twain

21.quote: “Are you implying that shreds of my reputation remain intact?" Will demanded with mock horror. "Clearly I have been doing something wrong. Or not something wrong, as the case may be."
