He banged on the side of the carriage. "Thomas! We must away at once to the nearest brothel. I seek scandal and low companionship.”
21.name: Cassandra Clare, Clockwork Angel

22.quote: “The truth is what I make it. I could set this world on fire and call it rain.”
22.name: Victoria Aveyard, Red Queen

23.quote: “You shall know the truth and the truth shall make you mad.”
23.name: Aldous Huxley

24.quote: “A word after a word after a word is power.”
24.name: Margaret Atwood

25.quote: “I drink to make other people more interesting.”
25.name: Hemingway, Ernest

26.quote: “Open your heart. Someone will come. Someone will come for you. But first you must open your heart.”
26.name: Kate DiCamillo, The Miraculous Journey of Edward Tulane

27.quote: “I do not think, sir, you have any right to command me, merely because you are older than I, or because you have seen more of the world than I have; your claim to superiority depends on the use you have made of your time and experience.”
27.name: Charlotte Brontë, Jane Eyre

28.quote: “The helpful thought for which you lookIs written somewhere in a book.”
28.name: Edward Gorey

29.quote: “Talk sense to a fool and he calls you foolish.”
29.name: Euripides, The Bacchae

0.quote: “Happiness is holding someone in your arms and knowing you hold the whole world.”
0.name: Orhan Pamuk, Snow

1.quote: “How nice -- to feel nothing, and still get full credit for being alive.”
1.name: Kurt Vonnegut, Slaughterhouse-Five

2.quote: “Who, being loved, is poor?”
2.name: Oscar Wilde

3.quote: “Our mothers always remain the strangest, craziest people we've ever met.”
3.name: Marguerite Duras

4.quote: “Don't compromise yourself - you're all you have.”
4.name: John Grisham, The Rainmaker

5.quote: “So many things become beautiful when you really look.”
5.name: Lauren Oliver, Before I Fall

6.quote: “If you think you are too small to make a difference, try sleeping with a mosquito.”
6.name: Dalai Lama XIV

7.quote: “Scared is what you're feeling. Brave is what you're doing.”
7.name: Emma Donoghue, Room

8.quote: “The greatest enemy of knowledge is not ignorance, it is the illusion of knowledge.”
8.name: Daniel J. Boorstin

9.quote: “Because you can't argue with all the fools in the world. It's easier to let them have their way, then trick them when they're not paying attention.”
9.name: Christopher Paolini

10.quote: “This is the way the world endsNot with a bang but a whimper.”
10.name: T.S. Eliot

11.quote: “A house without books is like a room without windows.”
11.name: Horace Mann

12.quote: “From there to here, from here to there, funny things are everywhere!”
12.name: Dr. Seuss, One Fish, Two Fish, Red Fish, Blue Fish

13.quote: “Wheresoever you go, go with all your heart.”
13.name: Confucius

14.quote: “Do your little bit of good where you are; it's those little bits of good put together that overwhelm the world.”
14.name: Desmond Tutu

15.quote: “All parents damage their children. It cannot be helped. Youth, like pristine glass, absorbs the prints of its handlers. Some parents smudge, others crack, a few shatter childhoods completely into jagged little pieces, beyond repair.”
15.name: Mitch Albom, The Five People You Meet in Heaven

16.quote: “She refused to be bored chiefly because she wasn't boring.”
16.name: Zelda Fitzgerald, The Collected Writings

17.quote: “One of the advantages of being disorganized is that one is always having surprising discoveries.”
17.name: A.A. Milne

18.quote: “I felt like crying but nothing came out. it was just a sort of sad sickness, sick sad, when you can't feel any worse. I think you know it. I think everybody knows it now and then. but I think I have known it pretty often, too often.”
18.name: Charles Bukowski, Tales of Ordinary Madness

19.quote: “If A is a success in life, then A equals x plus y plus z. Work is x; y is play; and z is keeping your mouth shut”
19.name: Albert Einstein

20.quote: “I thought I'd lie on the floor and writhe in pain for a while," he grunted, "It relaxes me.""It does? Oh - you're being sarcastic. That's a good sign probably.”
20.name: Cassandra Clare, City of Ashes

21.quote: “Do not be afraid; our fateCannot be taken from us; it is a gift.”
21.name: Dante Alighieri, Inferno

22.quote: “Even in the Future the Story Begins with Once Upon a Time.”
22.name: Marissa Meyer, Cinder

23.quote: “Did you ever think that in a past life Alec was an old woman with ninety cats who was always yelling at the neighborhood kids to get off her lawn? Because I do,”
23.name: Cassandra Clare, City of Glass

24.quote: “A man who procrastinates in his choosing will inevitably have his choice made for him by circumstance.”
24.name: Hunter S. Thompson, The Proud Highway: Saga of a Desperate Southern Gentleman,

25.quote: “The thing that is really hard, and really amazing, is giving up on being perfect and beginning the work of becoming yourself.”
25.name: Anna Quindlen

26.quote: “If you know someone who’s depressed, please resolve never to ask them why. Depression isn’t a straightforward response to a bad situation; depression just is, like the weather.Try to understand the blackness, lethargy, hopelessness, and loneliness they’re going through. Be there for them when they come through the other side. It’s hard to be a friend to someone who’s depressed, but it is one of the kindest, noblest, and best things you will ever do.”
26.name: Stephen Fry

27.quote: “What she was finding also was how one book led to another, doors kept opening wherever she turned and the days weren't long enough for the reading she wanted to do.”
27.name: Alan Bennett, The Uncommon Reader

28.quote: “Nothing in the world is more dangerous than sincere ignorance and conscientious stupidity.”
28.name: Martin Luther King Jr.

29.quote: “They say time heals all wounds, but that presumes the source of the grief is finite”
29.name: Cassandra Clare, Clockwork Prince

0.quote: “As it has been said:Love and a coughcannot be concealed.Even a small cough.Even a small love.”
0.name: Anne Sexton

1.quote: “Time is the longest distance between two places.”
1.name: Tennessee Williams, The Glass Menagerie

2.quote: “It is a curious thing, Harry, but perhaps those who are best suited to power are those who have never sought it. Those who, like you, have leadership thrust upon them, and take up the mantle because they must, and find to their own surprise that they wear it well.”
2.name: J.K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

3.quote: “By the pricking of my thumbs, Something wicked this way comes.”
3.name: William Shakespeare, Macbeth

4.quote: “Nitwit! Blubber! Oddment! Tweak!”
4.name: J.K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone

5.quote: “Forgive, O Lord, my little jokes on TheeAnd I'll forgive Thy great big one on me.”
5.name: Robert Frost

6.quote: “إن المرأة تحب رجلها ليس لأنه أقوى الرجال، و لا أوسمهم، و لا أغناهم، بل لأنه هو.. بضعفه و قوته.. و الحب ليس إستعراض قوة لكنه طاقة عطاء دافئة مستمرة”
6.name: أحمد خالد توفيق

7.quote: “Is there no way out of the mind?”
7.name: Sylvia Plath

8.quote: “You are not your job, you're not how much money you have in the bank. You are not the car you drive. You're not the contents of your wallet. You are not your fucking khakis. You are all singing, all dancing crap of the world.”
8.name: Chuck Palahniuk, Fight Club

9.quote: “The mind once enlightened cannot again become dark.”
9.name: Thomas Paine, A Letter Addressed to the Abbe Raynal on the Affairs of North America

10.quote: “Nobody tells this to people who are beginners, I wish someone told me. All of us who do creative work, we get into it because we have good taste. But there is this gap. For the first couple years you make stuff, it’s just not that good. It’s trying to be good, it has potential, but it’s not. But your taste, the thing that got you into the game, is still killer. And your taste is why your work disappoints you. A lot of people never get past this phase, they quit. Most people I know who do interesting, creative work went through years of this. We know our work doesn’t have this special thing that we want it to have. We all go through this. And if you are just starting out or you are still in this phase, you gotta know its normal and the most important thing you can do is do a lot of work. Put yourself on a deadline so that every week you will finish one story. It is only by going through a volume of work that you will close that gap, and your work will be as good as your ambitions. And I took longer to figure out how to do this than anyone I’ve ever met. It’s gonna take awhile. It’s normal to take awhile. You’ve just gotta fight your way through.”
10.name: Ira Glass

11.quote: “I'm on Aslan's side even if there isn't any Aslan to lead it. I'm going to live as like a Narnian as I can even if there isn't any Narnia.”
11.name: C.S. Lewis, The Silver Chair

12.quote: “I like to see people reunited, I like to see people run to each other, I like the kissing and the crying, I like the impatience, the stories that the mouth can't tell fast enough, the ears that aren't big enough, the eyes that can't take in all of the change, I like the hugging, the bringing together, the end of missing someone.”
12.name: Jonathan Safran Foer, Extremely Loud & Incredibly Close

13.quote: “No one has ever become poor by giving.”
13.name: Anne Frank, diary of Anne Frank: the play

14.quote: “The more you know who you are, and what you want, the less you let things upset you.”
14.name: Stephanie Perkins, Anna and the French Kiss

15.quote: “When people talk, listen completely. Most people never listen.”
15.name: Ernest Hemingway

16.quote: “Ah, my daughter,ʺ he said. ʺEighteen, and already youʹve been accused of murder, aided felons, and acquired a death count higher than most guardians will ever see.ʺ He paused. ʺI couldnʹt be prouder.”
16.name: Richelle Mead, Last Sacrifice

17.quote: “There are good days and hard days for me—even now. Don’t let the hard days win.”
17.name: Sarah J. Maas, A Court of Mist and Fury

18.quote: “There is something delicious about writing the first words of a story. You never quite know where they'll take you.”
18.name: Beatrix Potter

19.quote: “My concern is not whether God is on our side; my greatest concern is to be on God's side, for God is always right.”
19.name: Abraham Lincoln

20.quote: “Let me give you a piece of advice. The handsome young fellow who's trying to rescue you from a hideous fate is never wrong. Not even if he says the sky is purple and made of hedgehogs.”
20.name: Cassandra Clare, Clockwork Angel

21.quote: “No one can construct for you the bridge upon which precisely you must cross the stream of life, no one but you yourself alone.”
21.name: Friedrich Nietzsche

22.quote: “Love can change a person the way a parent can change a baby- awkwardly, and often with a great deal of mess.”
22.name: Lemony Snicket, Horseradish: Bitter Truths You Can't Avoid

23.quote: “Reputation is what other people know about you. Honor is what you know about yourself.”
23.name: Lois McMaster Bujold, A Civil Campaign

24.quote: “And I guess I realized at that moment that I really did love her. Because there was nothing to gain, and that didn't matter.”
24.name: Stephen Chbosky, The Perks of Being a Wallflower

25.quote: “Of all the words of mice and men, the saddest are, "It might have been.”
25.name: Kurt Vonnegut

26.quote: “the free soul is rare, but you know it when you see it - basically because you feel good, very good, when you are near or with them.”
26.name: Charles Bukowski, Tales of Ordinary Madness

27.quote: “Try a little harder to be a little better.”
27.name: Gordon B. Hinckley

28.quote: “The pleasure of all reading is doubled when one lives with another who shares the same books.”
28.name: Katherine Mansfield

29.quote: “Never make someone a priority when all you are to them is an option.”
29.name: Maya Angelou

0.quote: “Then the Grinch thought of something he hadn't before! What if Christmas, he thought, doesn't come from a store. What if Christmas...perhaps...means a little bit more!”
0.name: Dr. Seuss, How the Grinch Stole Christmas!

1.quote: “Whenever you read a cancer booklet or website or whatever, they always list depression among the side effects of cancer. But, in fact, depression is not a side effect of cancer. Depression is a side effect of dying.”
1.name: John Green, The Fault in Our Stars

2.quote: “The nitrogen in our DNA, the calcium in our teeth, the iron in our blood, the carbon in our apple pies were made in the interiors of collapsing stars. We are made of starstuff.”
2.name: Carl Sagan, Cosmos

3.quote: “You see I usually find myself among strangers because I drift here and there trying to forget the sad things that happened to me.”
3.name: F. Scott Fitzgerald, The Great Gatsby

4.quote: “You could have fooled me. Everytime I called you, Luke said you were sick. I figured you were avoiding me. Again.""I wasn't. I did want to talk to you. I've been thinking about you all the time.""I've been thinking about you, too.""I really was sick. I swear. I almost died back there on the ship, you know.""I know. Everytime you almost die, I almost die myself.”
4.name: Cassandra Clare, City of Ashes

5.quote: “Ever has it been that love knows not its own depth until the hour of separation.”
5.name: Kahlil Gibran

6.quote: “My soul will find yours.”
6.name: Jude Deveraux, A Knight in Shining Armor

7.quote: “The pleasure of remembering had been taken from me, because there was no longer anyone to remember with. It felt like losing your co-rememberer meant losing the memory itself, as if the things we'd done were less real and important than they had been hours before.”
7.name: John Green, The Fault in Our Stars

8.quote: “Knowing too much of your future is never a good thing.”
8.name: Rick Riordan, The Lightning Thief

9.quote: “I say let the world go to hell, but I should always have my tea.”
9.name: Fyodor Dostoevsky, Notes from Underground

10.quote: “It's not gray," Clary felt compelled to point out. "It's green.""If there was such a thing as terminal literalism, you'd have died in childhood," said Jace.”
10.name: Cassandra Clare, City of Bones

11.quote: “I don't want tea," said Clary, with muffled force. "I want to find my mother. And then I want to find out who took her in the first place, and I want to kill them.""Unfortunately," said Hodge, "we're all out of bitter revenge at the moment, so it's either tea or nothing.”
11.name: Cassandra Clare, City of Bones

12.quote: “That's what careless words do. They make people love you a little less.”
12.name: Arundhati Roy, The God of Small Things

13.quote: “Once upon a time, an angel and a devil fell in love. It did not end well.”
13.name: Laini Taylor, Daughter of Smoke & Bone

14.quote: “There is only one page left to write on. I will fill it with words of only one syllable. I love. I have loved. I will love.”
14.name: Dodie Smith, I Capture the Castle

15.quote: “She had always wanted words, she loved them; grew up on them. Words gave her clarity, brought reason, shape.”
15.name: Michael Ondaatje, The English Patient

16.quote: “I am different, not less.”
16.name: Temple Grandin

17.quote: “When did we see each other face-to-face? Not until you saw into my cracks and I saw into yours. Before that, we were just looking at ideas of each other, like looking at your window shade but never seeing inside. But once the vessel cracks, the light can get in. The light can get out.”
17.name: John Green, Paper Towns

18.quote: “Crying is for plain women. Pretty women go shopping.”
18.name: Oscar Wilde

19.quote: “I have the simplest tastes. I am always satisfied with the best.”
19.name: Oscar Wilde

20.quote: “To shine your brightest light is to be who you truly are.”
20.name: Roy T. Bennett

21.quote: “I wrote the story myself. It's about a girl who lost her reputation and never missed it.”
21.name: Mae West

22.quote: “When we least expect it, life sets us a challenge to test our courage and willingness to change; at such a moment, there is no point in pretending that nothing has happened or in saying that we are not yet ready. The challenge will not wait. Life does not look back. A week is more than enough time for us to decide whether or not to accept our destiny.”
22.name: Paulo Coelho, The Devil and Miss Prym

23.quote: “You're just worried they'll hire a male instructor and he'll be hotter than you." Jace's eyebrows went up. "Hotter than me?" "It could happen," Clary said, "You know, theoretically.""Theoretically the planet could suddenly crack in half, leaving me on one side and you on the other, forever and tragically parted, but I'm not worried about that either. Some things," Jace said, with his customary crooked smile, "are just too unlikely to dwell upon.”
23.name: Cassandra Clare, City of Fallen Angels

24.quote: “Courage is found in unlikely places.”
24.name: J.R.R. Tolkien

25.quote: “You may encounter many defeats, but you must not be defeated. In fact, it may be necessary to encounter the defeats, so you can know who you are, what you can rise from, how you can still come out of it.”
25.name: Maya Angelou

26.quote: “The beginning of love is the will to let those we love be perfectly themselves, the resolution not to twist them to fit our own image.”
26.name: Thomas Merton, The Way of Chuang Tzu

27.quote: “A childhood without books – that would be no childhood. That would be like being shut out from the enchanted place where you can go and find the rarest kind of joy.”
27.name: Astrid Lindgren

28.quote: “Reading brings us unknown friends”
28.name: Honore de Balzac

29.quote: “Sometimes, when I have to do something I don't want to do, I pretend I'm a character from a book. It's easier to know what they would do.”
29.name: Cassandra Clare, Clockwork Angel

0.quote: “Did you know that 'I told you so' has a brother,Jacob?" she asked cutting me off. "His name is 'Shut the hell up'.”
0.name: Stephenie Meyer, Breaking Dawn

1.quote: “We're staying together," he promised. "You're not getting away from me. Never again.”
1.name: Rick Riordan, The Mark of Athena

2.quote: “I'm a success today because I had a friend who believed in me and I didn't have the heart to let him down.”
2.name: Abraham Lincoln

3.quote: “You're an idiot.""I've never claimed to be otherwise.”
3.name: Cassandra Clare, City of Bones

4.quote: “May the odds be ever in your favor!”
4.name: Suzanne Collins, The Hunger Games

5.quote: “Strange as it may seem, I still hope for the best, even though the best, like an interesting piece of mail, so rarely arrives, and even when it does it can be lost so easily.”
5.name: Lemony Snicket, The Beatrice Letters

6.quote: “Give her hell from us, Peeves.”
6.name: J.K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix

7.quote: “Hope can be a powerful force. Maybe there's no actual magic in it, but when you know what you hope for most and hold it like a light within you, you can make things happen, almost like magic.”
7.name: Laini Taylor, Daughter of Smoke & Bone

8.quote: “In time, the hurt began to fade and it was easier to just let it go. At least I thought it was. But in every boy I met in the next few years, I found myself looking for you, and when the feelings got too strong, I'd write you another letter. But I never sent them for fear of what I might find. By then, you'd gone on with your life and I didn't want to think about you loving someone else. I wanted to remember us like we were that summer. I didn't ever want to lose that.”
8.name: Nicholas Sparks, The Notebook

9.quote: “If you work really hard, and you're kind, amazing things will happen.”
9.name: Conan O'Brien

10.quote: “Really, the combination of the scabs and the ointment looks hideous. I can't help enjoying his distress."Poor Finnick. Is this the first time in your life you haven't looked pretty?" I say."It must be. The sensation's completely new. How have you managed it all these years?" he asks."Just avoid mirrors. You'll forget about it," I say."Not if I keep looking at you," he says.”
10.name: Suzanne Collins, Catching Fire

11.quote: “Animals are my friends...and I don't eat my friends.”
11.name: George Bernard Shaw

12.quote: “Ah, music," he said, wiping his eyes. "A magic beyond all we do here!”
12.name: J.K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone

13.quote: “I haven't been everywhere, but it's on my list.”
13.name: Susan Sontag

14.quote: “The important thing to you is not how many years in your life, but how much life in your years!”
14.name: Edward J. Stieglitz

15.quote: “I always channel my emotions into my work. That way, I don't hurt anyone but myself.”
15.name: Suzanne Collins, Catching Fire

16.quote: “What do we live for, if it is not to make life less difficult for each other?”
16.name: George Eliot

17.quote: “Remain true to yourself, child. If you know your own heart, you will always have one friend who does not lie.”
17.name: Marion Zimmer Bradley, The Forest House

18.quote: “Don't let the bastards grind you down.”
18.name: Margaret Atwood, The Handmaid’s Tale

19.quote: “Where you used to be, there is a hole in the world, which I find myself constantly walking around in the daytime, and falling in at night. I miss you like hell.”
19.name: Edna St. Vincent Millay

20.quote: “If you love what you do and are willing to do what it takes, it's within your reach. And it'll be worth every minute you spend alone at night, thinking and thinking about what it is you want to design or build. It'll be worth it, I promise.”
20.name: Steve Wozniak

21.quote: “There is no place like home.”
21.name: L. Frank Baum, The Wonderful Wizard of Oz

22.quote: “You must not lose faith in humanity. Humanity is like an ocean; if a few drops of the ocean are dirty, the ocean does not become dirty.”
22.name: Mahatma Gandhi

23.quote: “Ask not what you can do for your country. Ask what’s for lunch.”
23.name: Orson Welles

24.quote: “You'd think people had better things to gossip about," said Ginny as she sat on the common room floor, leaning against Harry’s legs and reading the Daily Prophet. "Three Dementor attacks in a week, and all Romilda Vane does is ask me if it’s true you’ve got a Hippogriff tattooed across your chest."Ron and Hermione both roared with laughter. Harry ignored them.What did you tell her?"I told her it's a Hungarian Horntail," said Ginny, turning a page of the newspaper idly. "Much more macho."Thanks," said Harry, grinning. "And what did you tell her Ron’s got?"A Pygmy Puff, but I didn’t say where.”
24.name: J.K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

25.quote: “Every time you are tempted to react in the same old way, ask if you want to be a prisoner of the past or a pioneer of the future.”
25.name: Deepak Chopra

26.quote: “Faith is not the belief that God will do what you want. It is the belief that God will do what is right.”
26.name: Max Lucado, He Still Moves Stones: Everyone Needs a Miracle

27.quote: “What day is it?”
27.name: ked Pooh. “It’s today,” squeaked Piglet.“My favorite day,” said Pooh.” ― A.A. Milne

28.quote: “The heart has its reasons which reason knows not.”
28.name: Blaise Pascal

29.quote: “Have you really read all those books in your room?”
29.name: ska laughing- “Oh God no. I’ve maybe read a third of ‘em. But I’m going to read them all. I call it my Life’s Library. Every summer since I was little, I’ve gone to garage sales and bought all the books that looked interesting. So I always have something to read.” ― John Green, Looking for Alaska

0.quote: “When you play a game of thrones you win or you die.”
0.name: George R.R. Martin, A Game of Thrones

1.quote: “those who escape hellhowevernever talk aboutitand nothing muchbothers themafterthat.”
1.name: Charles Bukowski

2.quote: “If you look the right way, you can see that the whole world is a garden.”
2.name: Frances Hodgson Burnett, The Secret Garden

3.quote: “We are addicted to our thoughts. We cannot change anything if we cannot change our thinking.”
3.name: Santosh Kalwar, Quote Me Everyday

4.quote: “Sometimes you read a book so special that you want to carry it around with you for months after you've finished just to stay near it.”
4.name: Markus Zusak

5.quote: “Sell your cleverness and buy bewilderment.”
5.name: Rumi, Masnavi i Man'avi, the spiritual couplets of Maula

6.quote: “Sometimes you have to lose all you have to find out who you truly are.”
6.name: Roy T. Bennett, The Light in the Heart

7.quote: “Tomorrow may be hell, but today was a good writing day, and on the good writing days nothing else matters.”
7.name: Neil Gaiman

8.quote: “Be thankful for everything that happens in your life; it’s all an experience.”
8.name: Roy T. Bennett

9.quote: “True love is usually the most inconvenient kind.”
9.name: Kiera Cass, The Selection

10.quote: “Peeta, how come I never know when you're having a nightmare?”
10.name: say.“I don't know. I don't think I cry out or thrash around or anything. I just come to, paralyzed with terror,” he says.“You should wake me,” I say, thinking about how I can interrupt his sleep two or three times on a bad night. About how long it can take to calm me down.“It's not necessary. My nightmares are usually about losing you,” he says. “I'm okay once I realize you're here.” ― Suzanne Collins, Catching Fire

11.quote: “My name is Celaena Sardothien. But it makes no difference if my name's Celaena or Lillian or Bitch, because I'd still beat you, no matter what you call me.”
11.name: Sarah J. Maas, Throne of Glass

12.quote: “Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life.”
12.name: Pablo Picasso

13.quote: “I love books, by the way, way more than movies. Movies tell you what to think. A good book lets you choose a few thoughts for yourself. Movies show you the pink house. A good book tells you there's a pink house and lets you paint some of the finishing touches, maybe choose the roof style,park your own car out front. My imagination has always topped anything a movie could come up with. Case in point, those darned Harry Potter movies. That was so not what that part-Veela-chick, Fleur Delacour, looked like.”
13.name: Karen Marie Moning, Darkfever

14.quote: “و كن من أنتَ حيث تكون و احمل عبءَ قلبِكَ وحدهُ”
14.name: محمود درويش

15.quote: “I meant what I said and I said what I meant. An elephant's faithful one-hundred percent!”
15.name: Dr. Seuss, Horton Hatches the Egg

16.quote: “Tears are words that need to be written.”
16.name: Paulo Coelho

17.quote: “Come sleep with me: We won't make Love, Love will make us.”
17.name: Julio Cortázar

18.quote: “I don't think of all the misery, but of the beauty that still remains.”
18.name: Anne Frank, The Diary of a Young Girl

19.quote: “Whatever you're meant to do, do it now. The conditions are always impossible.”
19.name: Doris Lessing

20.quote: “Friendship marks a life even more deeply than love. Love risks degenerating into obsession, friendship is never anything but sharing.”
20.name: Elie Wiesel

21.quote: “Sometimes beautiful things come into our lives out of nowhere. We can't always understand them, but we have to trust in them. I know you want to question everything, but sometimes it pays to just have a little faith.”
21.name: Lauren Kate, Torment

22.quote: “In order to riseFrom its own ashesA phoenixFirstMustBurn.”
22.name: Octavia Butler, Parable of the Talents

23.quote: “Maybe some people just aren't meant to be in our lives forever. Maybe some people are just passing through. It's like some people just come through our lives to bring us something: a gift, a blessing, a lesson we need to learn. And that's why they're here. You'll have that gift forever.”
23.name: Danielle Steel, The Gift

24.quote: “I want you always to remember me. Will you remember that I existed, and that I stood next to you here like this?”
24.name: Haruki Murakami, Norwegian Wood

25.quote: “Remember, darkness does not always equate to evil, just as light does not always bring good.”
25.name: P.C. Cast, Betrayed

26.quote: “The reason it hurts so much to separate is because our souls are connected. Maybe they always have been and will be. Maybe we've lived a thousand lives before this one and in each of them we've found each other. And maybe each time, we've been forced apart for the same reasons. That means that this goodbye is both a goodbye for the past ten thousand years and a prelude to what will come.”
26.name: Nicholas Sparks, The Notebook

27.quote: “I myself have never been able to find out precisely what feminism is: I only know that people call me a feminist whenever I express sentiments that differentiate me from a doormat.”
27.name: Rebecca West

28.quote: “Words were different when they lived inside of you.”
28.name: Benjamin Alire Sáenz, Aristotle and Dante Discover the Secrets of the Universe

29.quote: “Time was passing like a hand waving from a train I wanted to be on. I hope you never have to think about anything as much as I think about you.”
29.name: jonathan safran foer

0.quote: “I may not have been sure about what really did interest me, but I was absolutely sure about what didn't.”
0.name: Albert Camus, The Stranger

1.quote: “When you are content to be simply yourself and don't compare or compete, everyone will respect you.”
1.name: Lao Tzu, Tao Te Ching

2.quote: “A wonderful fact to reflect upon, that every human creature is constituted to be that profound secret and mystery to every other.”
2.name: Charles Dickens, A Tale of Two Cities

3.quote: “There are so many ways to be brave in this world. Sometimes bravery involves laying down your life for something bigger than yourself, or for someone else. Sometimes it involves giving up everything you have ever known, or everyone you have ever loved, for the sake of something greater.But sometimes it doesn't.Sometimes it is nothing more than gritting your teeth through pain, and the work of every day, the slow walk toward a better life. That is the sort of bravery I must have now.”
3.name: Veronica Roth, Allegiant

4.quote: “Time is the coin of your life. You spend it. Do not allow others to spend it for you.”
4.name: Carl Sandburg

5.quote: “A diary with no drawings of me in it? Where are the torrid fantasies? The romance covers?”
5.name: Cassandra Clare, City of Bones

6.quote: “The longer and more carefully we look at a funny story, the sadder it becomes.”
6.name: Nikolai V. Gogol

7.quote: “Therefore, dear Sir, love your solitude and try to sing out with the pain it causes you. For those who are near you are far away... and this shows that the space around you is beginning to grow vast.... be happy about your growth, in which of course you can't take anyone with you, and be gentle with those who stay behind; be confident and calm in front of them and don't torment them with your doubts and don't frighten them with your faith or joy, which they wouldn't be able to comprehend. Seek out some simple and true feeling of what you have in common with them, which doesn't necessarily have to alter when you yourself change again and again; when you see them, love life in a form that is not your own and be indulgent toward those who are growing old, who are afraid of the aloneness that you trust.... and don't expect any understanding; but believe in a love that is being stored up for you like an inheritance, and have faith that in this love there is a strength and a blessing so large that you can travel as far as you wish without having to step outside it.”
7.name: Rainer Maria Rilke, Letters to a Young Poet

8.quote: “There is only one good, knowledge, and one evil, ignorance.”
8.name: Socrates

9.quote: “The trouble is not that I am single and likely to stay single, but that I am lonely and likely to stay lonely.”
9.name: Charlotte Brontë

10.quote: “I'm going to wake Peeta," I say."No, wait," says Finnick. "Let's do it together. Put our faces right in front of his."Well, there's so little opportunity for fun left in my life, I agree. We position ourselves on either side of Peeta, lean over until our faces are inches frim his nose, and give him a shake. "Peeta. Peeta, wake up," I say in a soft, singsong voice.His eyelids flutter open and then he jumps like we've stabbed him. "Aa!"Finnick and I fall back in the sand, laughing our heads off. Every time we try to stop, we look at Peeta's attempt to maintain a disdainful expression and it sets us off again.”
10.name: Suzanne Collins, Catching Fire

11.quote: “I'm sick of just liking people. I wish to God I could meet somebody I could respect.”
11.name: J.D. Salinger, Franny and Zooey

12.quote: “He accused me of being Dumbledore's man through and through.""How very rude of him.""I told him I was."Dumbledore opened his mouth to speak and then closed it again. Fawkes the phoenix let out a low, soft, musical cry. To Harry's intense embarrassment, he suddenly realized that Dumbledore's bright blue eyes looked rather watery, and stared hastily at his own knee. When Dumbledore spoke, however, his voice was quite steady. "I am very touched, Harry.”
12.name: J.K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

13.quote: “It is good to have an end to journey toward; but it is the journey that matters, in the end.”
13.name: Ursula K. Le Guin, The Left Hand of Darkness

14.quote: “so I wait for you like a lonely housetill you will see me again and live in me.Till then my windows ache.”
14.name: Pablo Neruda,

15.quote: “It's not worth doing something unless someone, somewhere, would much rather you weren't doing it.”
15.name: Terry Pratchett

16.quote: “He was gone, and I did not have time to tell him what I had just now realized: that I forgave him, and that she forgave us, and that we had to forgive to survive in the labyrinth. There were so many of us who would have to live with things done and things left undone that day. Things that did not go right, things that seemed okay at the time because we could not see the future. If only we could see the endless string of consequences that result from our smallest actions. But we can’t know better until knowing better is useless. And as I walked back to give Takumi’s note to the Colonel, I saw that I would never know. I would never know her well enough to know her thoughts in those last minutes, would never know if she left us on purpose. But the not-knowing would not keep me from caring, and I would always love Alaska Young, my crooked neighbor, with all my crooked heart.”
16.name: John Green, Looking for Alaska

17.quote: “It is easy to love people in memory; the hard thing is to love them when they are there in front of you.”
17.name: John Updike, My Father's Tears and Other Stories

18.quote: “People come, people go – they’ll drift in and out of your life, almost like characters in a favorite book. When you finally close the cover, the characters have told their story and you start up again with another book, complete with new characters and adventures. Then you find yourself focusing on the new ones, not the ones from the past.”
18.name: Nicholas Sparks, The Rescue

19.quote: “You know how they say you only hurt the ones you love? Well, it works both ways.”
19.name: Chuck Palahniuk, Fight Club

20.quote: “Tis the privilege of friendship to talk nonsense, and to have her nonsense respected.”
20.name: Charles Lamb, The Life, Letters and Writings of Charles Lamb Volume 3

21.quote: “I am always saying "Glad to've met you" to somebody I'm not at all glad I met. If you want to stay alive, you have to say that stuff, though.”
21.name: J.D. Salinger, The Catcher in the Rye

22.quote: “You can only become truly accomplished at something you love. Don’t make money your goal. Instead pursue the things you love doing and then do them so well that people can’t take their eyes off of you.”
22.name: Maya Angelou

23.quote: “From childhood's hour I have not been. As others were, I have not seen. As others saw, I could not awaken. My heart to joy at the same tone. And all I loved, I loved alone.”
23.name: Edgar Allan Poe

24.quote: “When I was about eight, I decided that the most wonderful thing, next to a human being, was a book.”
24.name: Margaret Walker

25.quote: “And I urge you to please notice when you are happy, and exclaim or murmur or think at some point, 'If this isn't nice, I don't know what is.”
25.name: Kurt Vonnegut Jr., A Man Without a Country

26.quote: “Memories, even your most precious ones, fade surprisingly quickly. But I don’t go along with that. The memories I value most, I don’t ever see them fading.”
26.name: Kazuo Ishiguro, Never Let Me Go

27.quote: “Happiness consists in getting enough sleep. Just that, nothing more.”
27.name: Robert A. Heinlein, Starship Troopers

28.quote: “Once upon a midnight dreary, while I pondered, weak and weary,Over many a quaint and curious volume of forgotten lore,While I nodded, nearly napping, suddenly there came a tapping,As of some one gently rapping, rapping at my chamber door.Tis some visitor," I muttered, "tapping at my chamber door — Only this, and nothing more."Ah, distinctly I remember it was in the bleak December,And each separate dying ember wrought its ghost upon the floor.Eagerly I wished the morrow; — vainly I had sought to borrowFrom my books surcease of sorrow — sorrow for the lost Lenore —For the rare and radiant maiden whom the angels name Lenore — Nameless here for evermore.And the silken sad uncertain rustling of each purple curtainThrilled me — filled me with fantastic terrors never felt before;So that now, to still the beating of my heart, I stood repeating,Tis some visitor entreating entrance at my chamber door —Some late visitor entreating entrance at my chamber door; — This it is, and nothing more."Presently my soul grew stronger; hesitating then no longer,Sir," said I, "or Madam, truly your forgiveness I implore;But the fact is I was napping, and so gently you came rapping,And so faintly you came tapping, tapping at my chamber door,That I scarce was sure I heard you"— here I opened wide the door; — Darkness there, and nothing more.Deep into that darkness peering, long I stood there wondering, fearing,Doubting, dreaming dreams no mortals ever dared to dream before;But the silence was unbroken, and the stillness gave no token,And the only word there spoken was the whispered word, "Lenore?"This I whispered, and an echo murmured back the word, "Lenore!" — Merely this, and nothing more.Back into the chamber turning, all my soul within me burning,Soon again I heard a tapping somewhat louder than before.Surely," said I, "surely that is something at my window lattice:Let me see, then, what thereat is, and this mystery explore —Let my heart be still a moment and this mystery explore; — 'Tis the wind and nothing more."Open here I flung the shutter, when, with many a flirt and flutter,In there stepped a stately raven of the saintly days of yore;Not the least obeisance made he; not a minute stopped or stayed he;But, with mien of lord or lady, perched above my chamber door —Perched upon a bust of Pallas just above my chamber door — Perched, and sat, and nothing more.Then this ebony bird beguiling my sad fancy into smiling,By the grave and stern decorum of the countenance it wore.Though thy crest be shorn and shaven, thou," I said, "art sure no craven,Ghastly grim and ancient raven wandering from the Nightly shore —Tell me what thy lordly name is on the Night's Plutonian shore!" Quoth the Raven, "Nevermore."Much I marveled this ungainly fowl to hear discourse so plainly,Though its answer little meaning— little relevancy bore;For we cannot help agreeing that no living human beingEver yet was blest with seeing bird above his chamber door —Bird or beast upon the sculptured bust above his chamber door, With such name as "Nevermore.”
28.name: Edgar Allan Poe, The Raven

29.quote: “You want to know about anybody? See what books they read, and how they've been read...”
29.name: Keri Hulme, The Bone People

0.quote: “I read once that the ancient Egyptians had fifty words for sand & the Eskimos had a hundred words for snow. I wish I had a thousand words for love, but all that comes to mind is the way you move against me while you sleep & there are no words for that.”
0.name: Brian Andreas, Story People

1.quote: “Adults are just obsolete children and the hell with them.”
1.name: Dr. Seuss

2.quote: “The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes.”
2.name: Marcel Proust

3.quote: “Always go to other people's funerals, otherwise they won't come to yours.”
3.name: Yogi Berra, When You Come to a Fork in the Road, Take It!: Inspiration and Wisdom from One of Baseball's Greatest Heroes

4.quote: “There are two means of refuge from the misery of life — music and cats.”
4.name: Albert Schweitzer

5.quote: “It's no good pretending that any relationship has a future if your record collections disagree violently or if your favorite films wouldn't even speak to each other if they met at a party.”
5.name: Nick Hornby

6.quote: “There are only the pursued, the pursuing, the busy and the tired.”
6.name: F. Scott Fitzgerald, The Great Gatsby

7.quote: “The scar had not pained Harry for nineteen years. All was well.”
7.name: J.K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

8.quote: “I can only note that the past is beautiful because one never realises an emotion at the time. It expands later, and thus we don't have complete emotions about the present, only about the past.”
8.name: Virginia Woolf

9.quote: “You are all the colors in one, at full brightness.”
9.name: Jennifer Niven, All the Bright Places

10.quote: “If I loved you less, I might be able to talk about it more.”
10.name: Jane Austen, Emma

11.quote: “There's things that happen in a person's life that are so scorched in the memory and burned into the heart that there's no forgetting them.”
11.name: John Boyne

12.quote: “I've got the guts to die. What I want to know is, have you got the guts to live?”
12.name: Tennessee Williams, Cat on a Hot Tin Roof

13.quote: “You are not entitled to your opinion. You are entitled to your informed opinion. No one is entitled to be ignorant.”
13.name: Harlan Ellison

14.quote: “I like too many things and get all confused and hung-up running from one falling star to another till i drop. This is the night, what it does to you. I had nothing to offer anybody except my own confusion.”
14.name: Jack Kerouac

15.quote: “If we couldn't laugh we would all go insane.”
15.name: Robert Frost

16.quote: “What do you want?""Just coffee. Black - like my soul.”
16.name: Cassandra Clare, City of Bones

17.quote: “Lost love is still love. It takes a different form, that's all. You can't see their smile or bring them food or tousle their hair or move them around a dance floor. But when those senses weaken another heightens. Memory. Memory becomes your partner. You nurture it. You hold it. You dance with it.”
17.name: Mitch Albom

18.quote: “Anxiety is the dizziness of freedom.”
18.name: Søren Kierkegaard , The Concept of Anxiety: A Simple Psychologically Orienting Deliberation on the Dogmatic Issue of Hereditary Sin

19.quote: “Pretty women wonder where my secret lies.I'm not cute or built to suit a fashion model's sizeBut when I start to tell them,They think I'm telling lies.I say,It's in the reach of my armsThe span of my hips,The stride of my step,The curl of my lips.I'm a womanPhenomenally.Phenomenal woman,That's me.”
19.name: Maya Angelou, Phenomenal Woman: Four Poems Celebrating Women

20.quote: “If you don't know history, then you don't know anything. You are a leaf that doesn't know it is part of a tree. ”
20.name: Michael Crichton

21.quote: “Somewhere over the rainbow, skies are blue, and the dreams that you dare to dream really do come true.”
21.name: E.Y. Harburg

22.quote: “The spell. Victor said you had to want me... to care about me... for it to work." When he didn't say anything, I tried to grip his shirt, but my fingers were too weak. "Did you? Did you want me?"His words came out thickly. "Yes, Roza. I did want you. I still do. I wish... we could be together.""Then why did you lie to me?"We reached the clinic, and he managed to open the door while still holding me. As soon as he stepped inside, he began yelling for help. "Why did you lie?" I murmured again.Still holding me in his arms, he looked down at me. I could hear voices and footsteps getting closer."Because we can't be together.""Because of the age thing, right?" I asked. "Because you're my mentor?"His fingertip gently wiped away a tear that had escaped down my cheek. "That's part of it," he said. "But also... well, you and I will both be Lissa's gaurdians someday. I need to protect her at all cost. If a pack of Strogoi come, I need to throw my body between them and her."I know that. Of course that's what you have to do." The black sparkles were dancing in front of my eyes again. I was fading out."No. If I let myself love you, I won't throw myself in front of her. I'll throw myself in front of you.”
22.name: Richelle Mead, Vampire Academy

23.quote: “I cannot go to school today"Said little Peggy Ann McKay."I have the measles and the mumps,A gash, a rash and purple bumps.My mouth is wet, my throat is dry.I'm going blind in my right eye.My tonsils are as big as rocks,I've counted sixteen chicken pox.And there's one more - that's seventeen,And don't you think my face looks green?My leg is cut, my eyes are blue,It might be the instamatic flu.I cough and sneeze and gasp and choke,I'm sure that my left leg is broke.My hip hurts when I move my chin,My belly button's caving in.My back is wrenched, my ankle's sprained,My 'pendix pains each time it rains.My toes are cold, my toes are numb,I have a sliver in my thumb.My neck is stiff, my voice is weak,I hardly whisper when I speak.My tongue is filling up my mouth,I think my hair is falling out.My elbow's bent, my spine ain't straight,My temperature is one-o-eight.My brain is shrunk, I cannot hear,There's a hole inside my ear.I have a hangnail, and my heart is ...What? What's that? What's that you say?You say today is .............. Saturday?G'bye, I'm going out to play!”
23.name: Shel Silverstein

24.quote: “And all the books you've read have been read by other people. And all the songs you've loved have been heard by other people. And that girl that's pretty to you is pretty to other people. and that if you looked at these facts when you were happy, you would feel great because you are describing 'unity.”
24.name: Stephen Chbosky, The Perks of Being a Wallflower

25.quote: “I travel not to go anywhere, but to go. I travel for travel's sake. The great affair is to move.”
25.name: Robert Louis Stevenson, Travels with a Donkey in the Cévennes

26.quote: “It gives me strength to have somebody to fight for; I can never fight for myself, but, for others, I can kill.”
26.name: Emilie Autumn, The Asylum for Wayward Victorian Girls

27.quote: “When I was your age, television was called books.”
27.name: William Goldman, The Princess Bride

28.quote: “I used to dream about escaping my ordinary life, but my life was never ordinary. I had simply failed to notice how extraordinary it was.”
28.name: Ransom Riggs, Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children

29.quote: “The finest of pleasures are always the unexpected ones.”
29.name: Erin Morgenstern, The Night Circus

0.quote: “Boring damned people. All over the earth. Propagating more boring damned people. What a horror show. The earth swarmed with them.”
0.name: Charles Bukowski

1.quote: “It's not always necessary to be strong, but to feel strong.”
1.name: Jon Krakauer, Into the Wild

2.quote: “You never change your life until you step out of your comfort zone; change begins at the end of your comfort zone.”
2.name: Roy T. Bennett

3.quote: “The trouble is if you don’t spend your life yourself, other people spend it for you.”
3.name: Peter Shaffer, Five Finger Exercise

4.quote: “One wordFrees us of all the weight and pain of life:That word is love.”
4.name: Sophocles

5.quote: “Writing is like sex. First you do it for love, then you do it for your friends, and then you do it for money.”
5.name: Virginia Woolf

6.quote: “We are the music makers, and we are the dreamers of dreams.”
6.name: Arthur William Edgar O'Shaughnessy, Poems of Arthur O'Shaughnessy

7.quote: “Fear is a phoenix. You can watch it burn a thousand times and still it will return.”
7.name: Leigh Bardugo, Crooked Kingdom

8.quote: “Is it possible for home to be a person and not a place?”
8.name: Stephanie Perkins, Anna and the French Kiss

9.quote: “You must write every single day of your life... You must lurk in libraries and climb the stacks like ladders to sniff books like perfumes and wear books like hats upon your crazy heads... may you be in love every day for the next 20,000 days. And out of that love, remake a world.”
9.name: Ray Bradbury

10.quote: “I'm a business man," he'd told her. "No more, no less.""You're a thief, Kaz.""Isn't that what I just said?”
10.name: Leigh Bardugo, Six of Crows

11.quote: “It's hard to enjoy practical jokes when your whole life feels like one.”
11.name: Rick Riordan, The Last Olympian

12.quote: “A word to the wise ain't necessary, it's the stupid ones who need advice.”
12.name: Bill Cosby

13.quote: “Sometimes the Bible in the hand of one man is worse than a whisky bottle in the hand of (another)... There are just some kind of men who - who're so busy worrying about the next world they've never learned to live in this one, and you can look down the street and see the results.”
13.name: Harper Lee, To Kill a Mockingbird

14.quote: “Children have never been very good at listening to their elders, but they have never failed to imitate them.”
14.name: James Baldwin

15.quote: “We were like gods at the dawning of the world, & our joy was so bright we could see nothing else but the other.”
15.name: Madeline Miller, The Song of Achilles

16.quote: “I must have loved you a lot.”
16.name: Suzanne Collins, Mockingjay

17.quote: “The love of learning, the sequestered nooks,And all the sweet serenity of books”
17.name: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

18.quote: “[D]on't ever apologise to an author for buying something in paperback, or taking it out from a library (that's what they're there for. Use your library). Don't apologise to this author for buying books second hand, or getting them from bookcrossing or borrowing a friend's copy. What's important to me is that people read the books and enjoy them, and that, at some point in there, the book was bought by someone. And that people who like things, tell other people. The most important thing is that people read...”
18.name: Neil Gaiman

19.quote: “The greatness of a man is not in how much wealth he acquires, but in his integrity and his ability to affect those around him positively.”
19.name: Bob Marley

20.quote: “It is not the size of the dog in the fight that counts, but the fight in the dog that wins.”
20.name: Arthur G. Lewis, Stub Ends of Thought and Verse

21.quote: “Words, I think, are such unpredictable creatures. No gun, no sword, no army or king will ever be more powerful than a sentence. Swords may cut and kill, but words will stab and stay, burying themselves in our bones to become corpses we carry into the future, all the time digging and failing to rip their skeletons from our flesh.”
21.name: Tahereh Mafi, Ignite Me

22.quote: “Reading is the sole means by which we slip, involuntarily, often helplessly, into another's skin, another's voice, another's soul.”
22.name: Joyce Carol Oates

23.quote: “Very few of us are what we seem.”
23.name: Agatha Christie, The Man in the Mist

24.quote: “Friendship- my definition- is built on two things. Respect and trust. Both elements have to be there. And it has to be mutual. You can have respect for someone, but if you don't have trust, the friendship will crumble.”
24.name: Stieg Larsson, The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo

25.quote: “Trust your heart if the seas catch fire, live by love though the stars walk backward.”
25.name: E.E. Cummings

26.quote: “Truth only means something when it's hard to admit.”
26.name: Nicholas Sparks, The Last Song

27.quote: “Sometimes, I feel the past and the future pressing so hard on either side that there's no room for the present at all.”
27.name: Evelyn Waugh, Brideshead Revisited

28.quote: “Even in half demon hunter clothes, Clary thought, he looked like the kind of boy who'd come over your house to pick you up for a date and be polite to your parents and nice to your pets.Jace on the other hand, looked like the kind of boy who'd come over your house and burn it down just for kicks.”
28.name: Cassandra Clare, City of Bones

29.quote: “There must be those among whom we can sit down and weep and still be counted as warriors.”
29.name: Adrienne Rich

0.quote: “As a woman I have no country. As a woman I want no country. As a woman, my country is the whole world.”
0.name: Virginia Woolf

1.quote: “I think that we're all mentally ill. Those of us outside the asylums only hide it a little better - and maybe not all that much better after all.”
1.name: Stephen King

2.quote: “You can make anything by writing.”
2.name: C.S. Lewis

3.quote: “I like it when somebody gets excited about something. It's nice.”
3.name: J.D. Salinger, The Catcher in the Rye

4.quote: “A library is infinity under a roof.”
4.name: Gail Carson Levine

5.quote: “There is a crack in everything.That's how the light gets in.”
5.name: Leonard Cohen, Selected Poems, 1956-1968

6.quote: “I like flaws. I think they make things interesting.”
6.name: Sarah Dessen, The Truth About Forever

7.quote: “Don't give in to your fears. If you do, you won't be able to talk to your heart.”
7.name: Paulo Coelho, The Alchemist

8.quote: “Make your mistakes, take your chances, look silly, but keep on going. Don’t freeze up.”
8.name: Thomas Wolfe, You Can't Go Home Again

9.quote: “The brick walls are there for a reason. The brick walls are not there to keep us out. The brick walls are there to give us a chance to show how badly we want something. Because the brick walls are there to stop the people who don’t want it badly enough. They’re there to stop the other people.”
9.name: Randy Pausch, The Last Lecture

10.quote: “This was another of our fears: that Life wouldn't turn out to be like Literature.”
10.name: Julian Barnes, The Sense of an Ending

11.quote: “1. Be Impeccable With Your WordSpeak with integrity. Say only what you mean. Avoid using the word to speak against yourself or to gossip about others. Use the power of your word in the direction of truth and love. 2. Don't Take Anything PersonallyNothing others do is because of you. What others say and do is a projection of their own reality, their own dream. When you are immune to the opinions and actions of others, you won't be the victim of needless suffering. 3. Don't Make AssumptionsFind the courage to ask questions and to express what you really want. Communicate with others as clearly as you can to avoid misunderstandings, sadness and drama. With just this one agreement, you can completely transform your life. 4. Always Do Your BestYour best is going to change from moment to moment; it will be different when you are healthy as opposed to sick. Under any circumstance, simply do your best, and you will avoid self-judgment, self-abuse and regret.”
11.name: Don Miguel Ruiz

12.quote: “Do not let the memories of your past limit the potential of your future. There are no limits to what you can achieve on your journey through life, except in your mind.”
12.name: Roy T. Bennett, The Light in the Heart

13.quote: “Thinking something does not make it true. Wanting something does not make it real.”
13.name: Michelle Hodkin, The Unbecoming of Mara Dyer

14.quote: “Black holes are where God divided by zero.”
14.name: Albert Einstein

15.quote: “When one tugs at a single thing in nature, he finds it attached to the rest of the world.”
15.name: John Muir

16.quote: “You're a painter. You're a baker. You like to sleep with the windows open. You never take sugar in your tea. And you always double-knot your shoelaces.”
16.name: Suzanne Collins, Mockingjay

17.quote: “please believe that things are good with me, and even when they're not, they will be soon enough. And i will always believe the same about you.”
17.name: Stephen Chbosky, The Perks of Being a Wallflower

18.quote: “I've lived through some terrible things in my life, some of which actually happened.”
18.name: Mark Twain

19.quote: “When you laugh, laugh like hell. And when you get angry, get good and angry. Try to be alive. You will be dead soon enough.”
19.name: William Saroyan

20.quote: “Burdens are for shoulders strong enough to carry them.”
20.name: Margaret Mitchell, Gone with the Wind

21.quote: “When everything goes to hell, the people who stand by you without flinching -- they are your family. ”
21.name: Jim Butcher

22.quote: “Stop comparing yourself to other people, just choose to be happy and live your own life.”
22.name: Roy T. Bennett, The Light in the Heart

23.quote: “I hope that in this year to come, you make mistakes.Because if you are making mistakes, then you are making new things, trying new things, learning, living, pushing yourself, changing yourself, changing your world. You're doing things you've never done before, and more importantly, you're Doing Something.So that's my wish for you, and all of us, and my wish for myself. Make New Mistakes. Make glorious, amazing mistakes. Make mistakes nobody's ever made before. Don't freeze, don't stop, don't worry that it isn't good enough, or it isn't perfect, whatever it is: art, or love, or work or family or life.Whatever it is you're scared of doing, Do it.Make your mistakes, next year and forever.”
23.name: Neil Gaiman

24.quote: “Those who can make you believe absurdities, can make you commit atrocities.”
24.name: Voltaire

25.quote: “Remember if people talk behind your back, it only means you are two steps ahead.”
25.name: Fannie Flagg, Fried Green Tomatoes at the Whistle Stop Cafe

26.quote: “A woman's heart should be so hidden in God that a man has to seek Him just to find her.”
26.name: Maya Angelou

27.quote: “Grown-ups don't look like grown-ups on the inside either. Outside, they're big and thoughtless and they always know what they're doing. Inside, they look just like they always have. Like they did when they were your age. Truth is, there aren't any grown-ups. Not one, in the whole wide world.”
27.name: Neil Gaiman, The Ocean at the End of the Lane

28.quote: “May it be a light to you in dark places, when all other lights go out.”
28.name: J.R.R. Tolkien, The Fellowship of the Ring

29.quote: “If I’m honest I have to tell you I still read fairy-tales and I like them best of all.”
29.name: Audrey Hepburn

0.quote: “The most effective way to destroy people is to deny and obliterate their own understanding of their history.”
0.name: George Orwell

1.quote: “Some people have a way with words, and other people...oh, uh, not have way.”
1.name: Steve Martin

2.quote: “Selfishness is not living as one wishes to live, it is asking others to live as one wishes to live.”
2.name: Oscar Wilde

3.quote: “No book can be appreciated until it has been slept with and dreamed over.”
3.name: Eugene Field

4.quote: “الكراهية تكلف أكثر من الحب.. لأنها إحساس غير طبيعي.. إحساس عكسي مثل حركة الأجسام ضد جاذبية الأرض.. تحتاج إلى قوة إضافية وتستهلك وقوداً أكثر”
4.name: مصطفى محمود, في الحب والحياة

5.quote: “I am too intelligent, too demanding, and too resourceful for anyone to be able to take charge of me entirely. No one knows me or loves me completely. I have only myself”
5.name: Simone de Beauvoir

6.quote: “I have for the first time found what I can truly love–I have found you. You are my sympathy–my better self–my good angel–I am bound to you with a strong attachment. I think you good, gifted, lovely: a fervent, a solemn passion is conceived in my heart; it leans to you, draws you to my centre and spring of life, wrap my existence about you–and, kindling in pure, powerful flame, fuses you and me in one.”
6.name: Charlotte Bronte, Jane Eyre

7.quote: “I must be a mermaid, Rango. I have no fear of depths and a great fear of shallow living.”
7.name: Anais Nin

8.quote: “No matter how careful you are, there's going to be the sense you missed something, the collapsed feeling under your skin that you didn't experience it all. There's that fallen heart feeling that you rushed right through the moments where you should've been paying attention.Well, get used to that feeling. That's how your whole life will feel some day.This is all practice.”
8.name: Chuck Palahniuk, Invisible Monsters

9.quote: “If you have a sister and she dies, do you stop saying you have one? Or are you always a sister, even when the other half of the equation is gone?”
9.name: Jodi Picoult, My Sister's Keeper

10.quote: “Most of all, I hate you because I think of you. Often. It's disgusting, and I can't stop.”
10.name: Holly Black, The Cruel Prince

11.quote: “It is a far, far better thing that I do, than I have ever done; it is a far, far better rest that I go to than I have ever known.”
11.name: Charles Dickens, A Tale of Two Cities

12.quote: “But in a solitary life, there are rare moments when another soul dips near yours, as stars once a year brush the earth. Such a constellation was he to me.”
12.name: Madeline Miller, Circe

13.quote: “You know, Hobbes, some days even my lucky rocket ship underpants don't help.”
13.name: Bill Watterson

14.quote: “Never be bullied into silence. Never allow yourself to be made a victim. Accept no one's definition of your life, but define yourself.”
14.name: Harvey Fierstein

15.quote: “When one is in love, one always begins by deceiving one's self, and one always ends by deceiving others. That is what the world calls a romance.”
15.name: Oscar Wilde, The Picture of Dorian Gray

16.quote: “The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.”
16.name: Mahatma Gandhi

17.quote: “Behind every beautiful thing, there's some kind of pain.”
17.name: Bob Dylan

18.quote: “Life is not a matter of holding good cards, but of playing a poor hand well.”
18.name: Robert Louis Stevenson

19.quote: “No one ever told me that grief felt so like fear.”
19.name: C.S. Lewis, A Grief Observed

20.quote: “Ginny!" said Mr. Weasley, flabbergasted. "Haven't I taught you anything? What have I always told you? Never trust anything that can think for itself if you can't see where it keeps its brain?”
20.name: J.K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

21.quote: “Being a writer is a very peculiar sort of a job: it's always you versus a blank sheet of paper (or a blank screen) and quite often the blank piece of paper wins.”
21.name: Neil Gaiman

22.quote: “Man only likes to count his troubles; he doesn't calculate his happiness.”
22.name: Fyodor Dostoevsky, Notes from Underground, White Nights, The Dream of a Ridiculous Man, and Selections from The House of the Dead

23.quote: “Freeing yourself was one thing, claiming ownership of that freed self was another.”
23.name: Toni Morrison, Beloved

24.quote: “If I had my life to live over again, I would have made a rule to read some poetry and listen to some music at least once every week.”
24.name: Charles Darwin, The Autobiography of Charles Darwin, 1809–82

25.quote: “When the snows fall and the white winds blow, the lone wolf dies but the pack survives.”
25.name: George R.R. Martin, A Game of Thrones

26.quote: “He needed to tell her...what? That she was lovely and brave and better than anything he deserved. That he was twisted, crooked, wrong, but not so broken that he couldn't pull himself together into some semblance of a man for her. That without meaning to, he'd begun to lean on her, to look for her, to need her near. He needed to thank her for his new hat.”
26.name: Leigh Bardugo, Six of Crows

27.quote: “Can you understand? Someone, somewhere, can you understand me a little, love me a little? For all my despair, for all my ideals, for all that - I love life. But it is hard, and I have so much - so very much to learn.”
27.name: Sylvia Plath, The Journals of Sylvia Plath

28.quote: “The world was collapsing, and the only thing that really mattered to me was that she was alive.”
28.name: Rick Riordan, The Last Olympian

29.quote: “It's the job that's never started as takes longest to finish.”
29.name: J.R.R. Tolkien, The Lord of the Rings

0.quote: “You are not special. You're not a beautiful and unique snowflake. You're the same decaying organic matter as everything else. We're all part of the same compost heap. We're all singing, all dancing crap of the world.”
0.name: Chuck Palahniuk, Fight Club

1.quote: “The emotion that can break your heart is sometimes the very one that heals it...”
1.name: Nicholas Sparks, At First Sight

2.quote: “I will love you always. When this red hair is white, I will still love you. When the smooth softness of youth is replaced by the delicate softness of age, I will still want to touch your skin. When your face is full of the lines of every smile you have ever smiled, of every surprise I have seen flash through your eyes, when every tear you have ever cried has left its mark upon your face,I will treasure you all the more, because I was there to see it all. I will share your life with you, Meredith, and I will love you until the last breath leaves your body or mine.”
2.name: Laurell K. Hamilton, A Lick of Frost

3.quote: “Forbidden to remember, terrified to forget; it was a hard line to walk.”
3.name: Stephenie Meyer, New Moon

4.quote: “Remembering that you are going to die is the best way I know to avoid the trap of thinking you have something to lose. You are already naked. There is no reason not to follow your heart.”
4.name: Steve Jobs

5.quote: “Let the first act of every morning be to make the following resolve for the day:- I shall not fear anyone on Earth. - I shall fear only God. - I shall not bear ill will toward anyone. - I shall not submit to injustice from anyone. - I shall conquer untruth by truth. And in resisting untruth, I shall put up with all suffering.”
5.name: Mahatma Gandhi

6.quote: “My alone feels so good, I'll only have you if you're sweeter than my solitude.”
6.name: Warsan Shire

7.quote: “Books have to be heavy because the whole world's inside them.”
7.name: Cornelia Funke, Inkheart

8.quote: “The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.”
8.name: Edmund Burke

9.quote: “They always say time changes things, but you actually have to change them yourself.”
9.name: Andy Warhol, The Philosophy of Andy Warhol

10.quote: “Jace shook his blond head in exasperation. "You had to make a crazy jail friend, didn't you? You couldn't just count ceiling tiles or tame a pet mouse like normal prisoners do?”
10.name: Cassandra Clare, City of Glass

11.quote: “You are not rich until you have a rich heart.”
11.name: Roy T. Bennett, The Light in the Heart

12.quote: “When I saw you I fell in love, and you smiled because you knew.”
12.name: Arrigo Boito

13.quote: “People change and forget to tell each other.”
13.name: Lillian Hellman

14.quote: “The truth will set you free. But not until it is finished with you.”
14.name: David Foster Wallace, Infinite Jest

15.quote: “I fell in love with her when we were together, then fell deeper in love with her in the years we were apart.”
15.name: Nicholas Sparks, Dear John

16.quote: “I am only responsible for my own heart, you offered yours up for the smashing my darling. Only a fool would give out such a vital organ”
16.name: Anais Nin

17.quote: “Things need not have happened to be true. Tales and dreams are the shadow-truths that will endure when mere facts are dust and ashes, and forgot.”
17.name: Neil Gaiman, The Sandman Vol. 3: Dream Country

18.quote: “Better to die fighting for freedom then be a prisoner all the days of your life.”
18.name: Bob Marley

19.quote: “I could die for you. But I couldn't, and wouldn't, live for you.”
19.name: Ayn Rand, The Fountainhead

20.quote: “Heaven knows we need never be ashamed of our tears, for they are rain upon the blinding dust of earth, overlying our hard hearts. I was better after I had cried, than before--more sorry, more aware of my own ingratitude, more gentle.”
20.name: Charles Dickens, Great Expectations

21.quote: “I am not proud, but I am happy; and happiness blinds, I think, more than pride.”
21.name: Alexandre Dumas, The Count of Monte Cristo

22.quote: “You like someone who can't like you back because unrequited love can be survived in a way that once-requited love cannot. ”
22.name: John Green, Will Grayson, Will Grayson

23.quote: “The ultimate measure of a man is not where he stands in moments of comfort and convenience, but where he stands at times of challenge and controversy.”
23.name: Martin Luther King Jr.

24.quote: “It must require bravery to be honest all the time.”
24.name: Veronica Roth, Divergent

25.quote: “That's the thing about depression: A human being can survive almost anything, as long as she sees the end in sight. But depression is so insidious, and it compounds daily, that it's impossible to ever see the end.”
25.name: Elizabeth Wurtzel, Prozac Nation

26.quote: “Even the strongest and bravest must sometimes weep. It shows they have a great heart, one that can feel compassion for others.”
26.name: Brian Jacques, Redwall

27.quote: “One person's craziness is another person's reality.”
27.name: Tim Burton

28.quote: “The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.”
28.name: Sun Tzu, The Art of War

29.quote: “The more one judges, the less one loves.”
29.name: Honoré de Balzac, Physiologie Du Mariage

0.quote: “When we don't know who to hate, we hate ourselves.”
0.name: Chuck Palahniuk, Invisible Monsters

1.quote: “It ain't what they call you, it's what you answer to.”
1.name: W.C. Fields

2.quote: “Let the improvement of yourself keep you so busy that you have no time to criticize others.”
2.name: Roy T. Bennett, The Light in the Heart

3.quote: “If you have enough book space, I don't want to talk to you.”
3.name: Terry Pratchett

4.quote: “What happened down in the dungeons between you and Professor Quirrell is a complete secret, so, naturally the whole school knows.”
4.name: J. K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone

5.quote: “When the first baby laughed for the first time, its laugh broke into a thousand pieces, and they all went skipping about, and that was the beginning of fairies.”
5.name: J.M. Barrie, Peter Pan

6.quote: “If you're too open-minded; your brains will fall out.”
6.name: Lawrence Ferlinghetti

7.quote: “Stories can conquer fear, you know. They can make the heart bigger.”
7.name: Ben Okri

8.quote: “I don't like people who have never fallen or stumbled. Their virtue is lifeless and it isn't of much value. Life hasn't revealed its beauty to them. ”
8.name: Boris Pasternak

9.quote: “A friend said to me, “Hey you need to grow a pair. Grow a pair, Bro.”
9.name: ’s when someone calls you weak, but they associate it with a lack of testicles. Which is weird, because testicles are the most sensitive things in the world. If you suddenly just grew a pair, you’d be a lot more vulnerable. If you want to be tough, you should lose a pair. If you want to be real tough, you should grow a vagina. Those things can take a pounding.” ― Sheng Wang

10.quote: “I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it. The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear.”
10.name: Nelson Mandela

11.quote: “I am lonely, yet not everybody will do. I don't know why, some people fill the gaps and others emphasize my loneliness. In reality those who satisfy me are those who simply allow me to live with my ''idea of them.”
11.name: Anais Nin

12.quote: “No sight so sad as that of a naughty child," he began, "especially a naughty little girl. Do you know where the wicked go after death?""They go to hell," was my ready and orthodox answer."And what is hell? Can you tell me that?""A pit full of fire.""And should you like to fall into that pit, and to be burning there for ever?""No, sir.""What must you do to avoid it?"I deliberated a moment: my answer, when it did come was objectionable: "I must keep in good health and not die.”
12.name: Charlotte Brontë, Jane Eyre

13.quote: “Try to be a rainbow in someone's cloud.”
13.name: Maya Angelou, Letter to My Daughter

14.quote: “It is never too late to be wise.”
14.name: Daniel Defoe, Robinson Crusoe

15.quote: “Better a cruel truth than a comfortable delusion.”
15.name: Edward Abbey

16.quote: “Everything must be made as simple as possible. But not simpler.”
16.name: Albert Einstein

17.quote: “I hate to advocate drugs, alcohol, violence, or insanity to anyone, but they've always worked for me.”
17.name: Hunter S. Thompson

18.quote: “Life is too short to waste any amount of time on wondering what other people think about you. In the first place, if they had better things going on in their lives, they wouldn't have the time to sit around and talk about you. What's important to me is not others' opinions of me, but what's important to me is my opinion of myself.”
18.name: C. JoyBell C.

19.quote: “Whatever you are physically...male or female, strong or weak, ill or healthy--all those things matter less than what your heart contains. If you have the soul of a warrior, you are a warrior. All those other things, they are the glass that contains the lamp, but you are the light inside.”
19.name: Cassandra Clare, Clockwork Angel

20.quote: “Anyone can hide. Facing up to things, working through them, that's what makes you strong.”
20.name: Sarah Dessen

21.quote: “It is one of life's bitterest truths that bedtime so often arrives just when things are really getting interesting.”
21.name: Lemony Snicket, The Grim Grotto

22.quote: “Nothing great in the world was accomplished without passion.”
22.name: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel

23.quote: “...and then, I have nature and art and poetry, and if that is not enough, what is enough?”
23.name: Vincent Willem van Gogh

24.quote: “The only thing better than imagining Dimitri carrying me in his arms was imagining him shirtless while carrying me in his arms.”
24.name: Richelle Mead, Vampire Academy

25.quote: “To choose doubt as a philosophy of life is akin to choosing immobility as a means of transportation.”
25.name: Yann Martel, Life of Pi

26.quote: “Remember me and smile, for it's better to forget than to remember me and cry.”
26.name: Dr. Seuss

27.quote: “The Very first moment I beheld him, my heart was irrevocably gone.”
27.name: Jane Austen, Love and Friendship

28.quote: “ Loneliness is the human condition. Cultivate it. The way it tunnels into you allows your soul room to grow. Never expect to outgrow loneliness. Never hope to find people who will understand you, someone to fill that space. An intelligent, sensitive person is the exception, the very great exception. If you expect to find people who will understand you, you will grow murderous with disappointment. The best you'll ever do is to understand yourself, know what it is that you want, and not let the cattle stand in your way.”
28.name: Janet Fitch, White Oleander

29.quote: “Education: the path from cocky ignorance to miserable uncertainty.”
29.name: Mark Twain

0.quote: “I am free and that is why I am lost.”
0.name: Franz Kafka

1.quote: “I always arrive late at the office, but I make up for it by leaving early.”
1.name: Charles Lamb

2.quote: “My course is set for an uncharted sea.”
2.name: Dante Alighieri

3.quote: “I kept always two books in my pocket, one to read, one to write in.”
3.name: Robert Louis Stevenson, Essays of Robert Louis Stevenson

4.quote: “The price good men pay for indifference to public affairs is to be ruled by evil men.”
4.name: Plato

5.quote: “I imagine one of the reasons people cling to their hates so stubbornly is because they sense, once hate is gone, they will be forced to deal with pain.”
5.name: James Baldwin, The Fire Next Time

6.quote: “Where words leave off, music begins.”
6.name: Heinrich Heine

7.quote: “Atticus, he was real nice.""Most people are, Scout, when you finally see them.”
7.name: Harper Lee, To Kill a Mockingbird

8.quote: “Your silence will not protect you.”
8.name: Audre Lorde, Sister Outsider: Essays and Speeches

9.quote: “I hope you're pleased with yourselves. We could all have been killed - or worse, expelled. Now if you don't mind, I'm going to bed.”
9.name: J.K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone

10.quote: “What she had realized was that love was that moment when your heart was about to burst.”
10.name: Stieg Larsson, The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo

11.quote: “When God Created Mothers" When the Good Lord was creating mothers, He was into His sixth day of "overtime" when the angel appeared and said. "You're doing a lot of fiddling around on this one." And God said, "Have you read the specs on this order?" She has to be completely washable, but not plastic. Have 180 moveable parts...all replaceable. Run on black coffee and leftovers. Have a lap that disappears when she stands up. A kiss that can cure anything from a broken leg to a disappointed love affair. And six pairs of hands." The angel shook her head slowly and said. "Six pairs of hands.... no way." It's not the hands that are causing me problems," God remarked, "it's the three pairs of eyes that mothers have to have." That's on the standard model?" asked the angel. God nodded. One pair that sees through closed doors when she asks, 'What are you kids doing in there?' when she already knows. Another here in the back of her head that sees what she shouldn't but what she has to know, and of course the ones here in front that can look at a child when he goofs up and say. 'I understand and I love you' without so much as uttering a word." God," said the angel touching his sleeve gently, "Get some rest tomorrow...." I can't," said God, "I'm so close to creating something so close to myself. Already I have one who heals herself when she is sick...can feed a family of six on one pound of hamburger...and can get a nine year old to stand under a shower." The angel circled the model of a mother very slowly. "It's too soft," she sighed. But tough!" said God excitedly. "You can imagine what this mother can do or endure." Can it think?" Not only can it think, but it can reason and compromise," said the Creator. Finally, the angel bent over and ran her finger across the cheek. There's a leak," she pronounced. "I told You that You were trying to put too much into this model." It's not a leak," said the Lord, "It's a tear." What's it for?" It's for joy, sadness, disappointment, pain, loneliness, and pride." You are a genius, " said the angel. Somberly, God said, "I didn't put it there.”
11.name: Erma Bombeck, When God Created Mothers

12.quote: “If you have good friends, no matter how much life is sucking , they can make you laugh.”
12.name: P.C. Cast Kristin Cast

13.quote: “We rip out so much of ourselves to be cured of things faster than we should that we go bankrupt by the age of thirty and have less to offer each time we start with someone new. But to feel nothing so as not to feel anything - what a waste!”
13.name: Andre Aciman, Call Me by Your Name

14.quote: “Did you see that dress?”
14.name: saw the dress.” "Did you like it?” He didn't answer. I took that as a yes. "Am I going to endanger my reputation if I wear it to the dance?” When he spoke, I could barely hear him. "You'll endanger the school.” I smiled and fell asleep.” ― Richelle Mead, Vampire Academy

15.quote: “Sometimes things fall apart so that better things can fall together”
15.name: Marilyn Monroe

16.quote: “To love another person is to see the face of God.”
16.name: Victor Hugo, Les Misérables
