19.quote: “Love is like a tree: it grows by itself, roots itself deeply in our being and continues to flourish over a heart in ruin. The inexplicable fact is that the blinder it is, the more tenacious it is. It is never stronger than when it is completely unreasonable.”
19.name: Victor Hugo, The Hunchback of Notre-Dame

20.quote: “Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.”
20.name: Marcus Aurelius, Meditations

21.quote: “Luxury is not a necessity to me, but beautiful and good things are.”
21.name: Anais Nin

22.quote: “Without you in my arms, I feel an emptiness in my soul. I find myself searching the crowds for your face - I know it's an impossibility, but I cannot help myself.”
22.name: Nicholas Sparks, Message in a Bottle

23.quote: “I love mankind, he said, "but I find to my amazement that the more I love mankind as a whole, the less I love man in particular.”
23.name: Fyodor Dostoyevsky, The Brothers Karamazov

24.quote: “Of course motivation is not permanent. But then, neither is bathing; but it is something you should do on a regular basis.”
24.name: Zig Ziglar, Raising Positive Kids in a Negative World

25.quote: “If there's one thing I've learned, it's this: We all want everything to be okay. We don't even wish so much for fantastic or marvelous or outstanding. We will happily settle for okay, because most of the time, okay is enough.”
25.name: David Levithan, Every Day

26.quote: “Gus: "It tastes like..."Me: "Food."Gus: "Yes, precisely. It tastes like food, excellently prepared. But it does not taste, how do I put this delicately...?"Me: "It does not taste like God Himself cooked heaven into a series of five dishes which were then served to you accompanied by several luminous balls of fermented, bubbly plasma while actual and literal flower petals floated down around your canal-side dinner table."Gus: "Nicely phrased."Gus's father: "Our children are weird."My dad: "Nicely phrased.”
26.name: John Green, The Fault in Our Stars

27.quote: “What is straight? A line can be straight, or a street, but the human heart, oh, no, it's curved like a road through mountains.”
27.name: Tennessee Williams, A Streetcar Named Desire

28.quote: “How do I love thee? Let me count the ways.I love thee to the depth and breadth and heightMy soul can reach”
28.name: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

29.quote: “Nothing takes the taste out of peanut butter quite like unrequited love.”
29.name: Charles M. Schulz

0.quote: “Maybe this world is another planet’s hell.”
0.name: Aldous Huxley

1.quote: “Some things in life are out of your control. You can make it a party or a tragedy.”
1.name: Nora Roberts, Vision in White

2.quote: “The unfed mind devours itself.”
2.name: Gore Vidal

3.quote: “Have you tried talking to her?" "No. We've been punching her in the face repeatedly. What? You don't think that will work?”
3.name: Cassandra Clare, City of Glass

4.quote: “The desire to reach for the stars is ambitious. The desire to reach hearts is wise.”
4.name: Maya Angelou

5.quote: “No good deed goes unpunished.”
5.name: Oscar Wilde

6.quote: “If I read a book and it makes my whole body so cold no fire can ever warm me, I know that is poetry.”
6.name: Emily Dickinson

7.quote: “Will rolled up his sleeves. "We'll probably have to knock down the door--" "Or," said Jem, reaching out and giving the knob a twist, "not." The door swung open onto a rectangle of darkness. "Now, that's simply laziness," said Will.”
7.name: Cassandra Clare, Clockwork Angel

8.quote: “Don't aim at success. The more you aim at it and make it a target, the more you are going to miss it. For success, like happiness, cannot be pursued; it must ensue, and it only does so as the unintended side effect of one's personal dedication to a cause greater than oneself or as the by-product of one's surrender to a person other than oneself. Happiness must happen, and the same holds for success: you have to let it happen by not caring about it. I want you to listen to what your conscience commands you to do and go on to carry it out to the best of your knowledge. Then you will live to see that in the long-run—in the long-run, I say!—success will follow you precisely because you had forgotten to think about it”
8.name: Viktor E. Frankl, Man's Search for Meaning

9.quote: “Literature is a luxury; fiction is a necessity.”
9.name: G.K. Chesterton

10.quote: “There's a bluebird in my heart that wants to get outbut I'm too tough for him,I say, stay in there, I'm not going to let anybody see you.”
10.name: Charles Bukowski

11.quote: “There are much worse games to play.”
11.name: Suzanne Collins, Mockingjay

12.quote: “The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing. ”
12.name: Walt Disney

13.quote: “An intellectual? Yes. And never deny it. An intellectual is someone whose mind watches itself. I like this, because I am happy to be both halves, the watcher and the watched. "Can they be brought together?" This is a practical question. We must get down to it. "I despise intelligence" really means: "I cannot bear my doubts.”
13.name: Albert Camus

14.quote: “We dream in our waking moments, and walk in our sleep.”
14.name: Nathaniel Hawthorne, The Scarlet Letter

15.quote: “When you read a book, you hold another's mind in your hands.”
15.name: James Burke

16.quote: “I decided it is better to scream. Silence is the real crime against humanity.”
16.name: Nadezhda Mandelstam, Hope Against Hope

17.quote: “That which you believe becomes your world.”
17.name: Richard Matheson, What Dreams May Come

18.quote: “Being with you never felt wrong. It's the one thing I did right. You're the one thing I did right.”
18.name: Becca Fitzpatrick, Crescendo

19.quote: “So light a fire!" Harry choked. "Yes...of course...but there's no wood!" ... "HAVE YOU GONE MAD!" Ron bellowed. "ARE YOU A WITCH OR NOT!”
19.name: J.K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone

20.quote: “Pity those who don't feel anything at all.”
20.name: Sarah J. Maas, A Court of Thorns and Roses

21.quote: “District 12: Where you can starve to death in safety.”
21.name: Suzanne Collins, The Hunger Games

22.quote: “Now that she had nothing to lose, she was free.”
22.name: Paulo Coelho, Eleven Minutes

23.quote: “What draws people to be friends is that they see the same truth. They share it.”
23.name: C. S. Lewis

24.quote: “When I look at my life and its secret colours, I feel like bursting into tears.”
24.name: Albert Camus, A Happy Death

25.quote: “I suffer from girlnextdooritis where the guy is friends with you and that's it.”
25.name: Taylor Swift

26.quote: “There will be a few times in your life when all your instincts will tell you to do something, something that defies logic, upsets your plans, and may seem crazy to others. When that happens, you do it. Listen to your instincts and ignore everything else. Ignore logic, ignore the odds, ignore the complications, and just go for it.”
26.name: Judith McNaught, Remember When

27.quote: “It is easy in the world to live after the world's opinion; it is easy in solitude to live after our own; but the great man is he who in the midst of the crowd keeps with perfect sweetness the independence of solitude.”
27.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson, The Complete Prose Works Of Ralph Waldo Emerson

28.quote: “You believe in a book that has talking animals, wizards, witches, demons, sticks turning into snakes, burning bushes, food falling from the sky, people walking on water, and all sorts of magical, absurd and primitive stories, and you say that we are the ones that need help?”
28.name: Mark Twain

29.quote: “Women want love to be a novel. Men, a short story.”
29.name: Daphne du Maurier

0.quote: “God alert!" Blackjack yelled. "It's the wine dude!Mr. D sighed in exasperation. "The next person, or horse, who calls me the 'wine dude' will end up in a bottle of Merlot!”
0.name: Rick Riordan, The Titan's Curse

1.quote: “Lovers don't finally meet somewhere. They're in each other all along.”
1.name: Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi

2.quote: “The soul is healed by being with children.”
2.name: Fyodor Dostoevsky

3.quote: “When you consider things like the stars, our affairs don't seem to matter very much, do they?”
3.name: Virginia Woolf

4.quote: “You get what anybody gets - you get a lifetime.”
4.name: Neil Gaiman, The Sandman Vol. 1: Preludes & Nocturnes

5.quote: “We shall meet in the place where there is no darkness.”
5.name: George Orwell,

6.quote: “The sunlight claps the earth, and the moonbeams kiss the sea: what are all these kissings worth, if thou kiss not me?”
6.name: Percy Bysshe Shelley

7.quote: “Five exclamation marks, the sure sign of an insane mind.”
7.name: Terry Pratchett, Reaper Man

8.quote: “Adults are always asking little kids what they want to be when they grow up ’cause they’re looking for ideas.”
8.name: Paula Poundstone

9.quote: “The greatness of a nation and its moral progress can be judged by the way its animals are treated.”
9.name: Mahatma Gandhi

10.quote: “He allowed himself to be swayed by his conviction that human beings are not born once and for all on the day their mothers give birth to them, but that life obliges them over and over again to give birth to themselves.”
10.name: Gabriel García Márquez, Love in the Time of Cholera

11.quote: “However many holy words you read, however many you speak, what good will they do you if you do not act on upon them?”
11.name: Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni

12.quote: “The things we love destroy us every time, lad. Remember that.”
12.name: George R.R. Martin, A Game of Thrones

13.quote: “She was a genius of sadness, immersing herself in it, separating its numerous strands, appreciating its subtle nuances. She was a prism through which sadness could be divided into its infinite spectrum.”
13.name: Jonathan Safran Foer, Everything is Illuminated

14.quote: “There is nothing more deceptive than an obvious fact.”
14.name: Arthur Conan Doyle, The Boscombe Valley Mystery - a Sherlock Holmes Short Story

15.quote: “The most terrible poverty is loneliness, and the feeling of being unloved.”
15.name: Mother Teresa

16.quote: “It was a bright cold day in April, and the clocks were striking thirteen.”
16.name: George Orwell, 1984

17.quote: “To die, it's easy. But you have to struggle for life.”
17.name: Art Spiegelman, Maus I: A Survivor's Tale: My Father Bleeds History

18.quote: “I guess by now I should know enough about loss to realize that you never really stop missing someone-you just learn to live around the huge gaping hole of their absence.”
18.name: Alyson Noel, Evermore

19.quote: “Why do beautiful songs make you sad?' 'Because they aren't true.' 'Never?' 'Nothing is beautiful and true.”
19.name: Jonathan Safran Foer, Extremely Loud & Incredibly Close

20.quote: “A girl calls and asks, "Does it hurt very much to die?""Well, sweetheart," I tell her, "yes, but it hurts a lot more to keep living.”
20.name: Chuck Palahniuk, Survivor

21.quote: “It is not the length of life, but the depth.”
21.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

22.quote: “When someone you love dies, and you're not expecting it, you don't lose her all at once; you lose her in pieces over a long time—the way the mail stops coming, and her scent fades from the pillows and even from the clothes in her closet and drawers. Gradually, you accumulate the parts of her that are gone. Just when the day comes—when there's a particular missing part that overwhelms you with the feeling that she's gone, forever—there comes another day, and another specifically missing part.”
22.name: John Irving, A Prayer for Owen Meany

23.quote: “Believe in your infinite potential. Your only limitations are those you set upon yourself.”
23.name: Roy T. Bennett, The Light in the Heart

24.quote: “In the world I amAlways a strangerI do not understand its languageIt does not understand my silence”
24.name: Bei Dao

25.quote: “Always be a first rate version of yourself and not a second rate version of someone else.”
25.name: Judy Garland

26.quote: “Humor is reason gone mad.”
26.name: Groucho Marx

27.quote: “Death is so terribly final, while life is full of possibilities.”
27.name: George R.R. Martin, A Game of Thrones

28.quote: “A short story is a different thing altogether – a short story is like a quick kiss in the dark from a stranger.”
28.name: Stephen King, Skeleton Crew

29.quote: “The role of a writer is not to say what we can all say, but what we are unable to say.”
29.name: Anais Nin

0.quote: “She looked at nice young men as if she could smell their stupidity.”
0.name: Flannery O'Connor

1.quote: “Music is ... A higher revelation than all Wisdom & Philosophy”
1.name: Ludwig van Beethoven

2.quote: “But I believe in true love, you know? I don't believe that everybody gets to keep their eyes or not get sick or whatever, but everybody should have true love, and it should last at least as long as your life does.”
2.name: John Green, The Fault in Our Stars

3.quote: “Sometimes, the best way to help someone is just to be near them.”
3.name: Veronica Roth, Divergent

4.quote: “The purpose of a storyteller is not to tell you how to think, but to give you questions to think upon.”
4.name: Brandon Sanderson, The Way of Kings

5.quote: “Let no one ever come to you without leaving better and happier. Be the living expression of God's kindness: kindness in your face, kindness in your eyes, kindness in your smile.”
5.name: Mother Teresa

6.quote: “I write differently from what I speak, I speak differently from what I think, I think differently from the way I ought to think, and so it all proceeds into deepest darkness.”
6.name: Franz Kafka

7.quote: “But until a person can say deeply and honestly, "I am what I am today because of the choices I made yesterday," that person cannot say, "I choose otherwise.”
7.name: Stephen R. Covey, The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People: Powerful Lessons in Personal Change

8.quote: “There is nothing like looking, if you want to find something. You certainly usually find something, if you look, but it is not always quite the something you were after.”
8.name: J.R.R. Tolkien, The Hobbit

9.quote: “Freedom (n.): To ask nothing. To expect nothing. To depend on nothing.”
9.name: Ayn Rand, The Fountainhead

10.quote: “All right," said Susan. "I'm not stupid. You're saying humans need... fantasies to make life bearable."REALLY? AS IF IT WAS SOME KIND OF PINK PILL? NO. HUMANS NEED FANTASY TO BE HUMAN. TO BE THE PLACE WHERE THE FALLING ANGEL MEETS THE RISING APE."Tooth fairies? Hogfathers? Little—"YES. AS PRACTICE. YOU HAVE TO START OUT LEARNING TO BELIEVE THE LITTLE LIES."So we can believe the big ones?"YES. JUSTICE. MERCY. DUTY. THAT SORT OF THING."They're not the same at all!"YOU THINK SO? THEN TAKE THE UNIVERSE AND GRIND IT DOWN TO THE FINEST POWDER AND SIEVE IT THROUGH THE FINEST SIEVE AND THEN SHOW ME ONE ATOM OF JUSTICE, ONE MOLECULE OF MERCY. AND YET—Death waved a hand. AND YET YOU ACT AS IF THERE IS SOME IDEAL ORDER IN THE WORLD, AS IF THERE IS SOME...SOME RIGHTNESS IN THE UNIVERSE BY WHICH IT MAY BE JUDGED."Yes, but people have got to believe that, or what's the point—"MY POINT EXACTLY.”
10.name: Terry Pratchett, Hogfather

11.quote: “Jane, be still; don't struggle so like a wild, frantic bird, that is rending its own plumage in its desperation.""I am no bird; and no net ensnares me; I am a free human being, with an independent will; which I now exert to leave you.”
11.name: Charlotte Brontë , Jane Eyre

12.quote: “You live like this, sheltered, in a delicate world, and you believe you are living. Then you read a book… or you take a trip… and you discover that you are not living, that you are hibernating. The symptoms of hibernating are easily detectable: first, restlessness. The second symptom (when hibernating becomes dangerous and might degenerate into death): absence of pleasure. That is all. It appears like an innocuous illness. Monotony, boredom, death. Millions live like this (or die like this) without knowing it. They work in offices. They drive a car. They picnic with their families. They raise children. And then some shock treatment takes place, a person, a book, a song, and it awakens them and saves them from death. Some never awaken.”
12.name: Anaïs Nin, The Diary of Anaïs Nin, Vol. 1: 1931-1934

13.quote: “I want everyone to meet you. You're my favorite person of all time.”
13.name: Rainbow Rowell, Eleanor & Park

14.quote: “I feel like someone breathed new air into my lungs. I am not Abnegation. I am not Dauntless. I am Divergent.”
14.name: Veronica Roth, Divergent

15.quote: “I'm always happy," Sasha said. "Sometimes I just forget.”
15.name: Jennifer Egan, A Visit from the Goon Squad

16.quote: “Sometimes you lose a battle. But mischief always wins the war”
16.name: John Green, Looking for Alaska

17.quote: “Until you make the unconscious conscious, it will direct your life and you will call it fate.”
17.name: C.G. Jung

18.quote: “There is no such thing as a "broken family." Family is family, and is not determined by marriage certificates, divorce papers, and adoption documents. Families are made in the heart. The only time family becomes null is when those ties in the heart are cut. If you cut those ties, those people are not your family. If you make those ties, those people are your family. And if you hate those ties, those people will still be your family because whatever you hate will always be with you.”
18.name: C. JoyBell C.

19.quote: “When people say impossible, they usually mean improbable.”
19.name: Leigh Bardugo, Siege and Storm

20.quote: “I never forget a face, but in your case I'll be glad to make an exception.”
20.name: Groucho Marx

21.quote: “My religion is very simple. My religion is kindness.”
21.name: Dalai Lama XIV

22.quote: “What's up?" I asked.You tell me," he said. "You were the one about ready to start making out with Adrian."It was an experiment," I said. "It was part of my therapy."What the hell kind of therapy are you in?”
22.name: Richelle Mead, Shadow Kiss

23.quote: “To survive, you must tell stories.”
23.name: Umberto Eco, The Island Of The Day Before

24.quote: “When you go into the ER, one of the first things they ask you to do is rate your pain on a scale of one to ten, and from there they decide which drugs to use and how quickly to use them. I'd been asked this question hundreds of times over the years, and I remember once early on when I couldn't get my breath and it felt like my chest was on fire, flames licking the inside of my ribs fighting for a way to burn out of my body, my parents took me to the ER. nurse asked me about the pain, and I couldn't even speak, so I held up nine fingers.Later, after they'd given me something, the nurse came in and she was kind of stroking my head while she took my blood pressure and said, "You know how I know you're a fighter? You called a ten a nine."But that wasn't quite right. I called it a nine because I was saving my ten. And here it was, the great and terrible ten, slamming me again and again as I lay still and alone in my bed staring at the ceiling, the waves tossing me against the rocks then pulling me back out to sea so they could launch me again into the jagged face of the cliff, leaving me floating faceup on the water, undrowned.”
24.name: John Green, The Fault in Our Stars

25.quote: “One should always be drunk. That's all that matters...But with what? With wine, with poetry, or with virtue, as you chose. But get drunk.”
25.name: Charles Baudelaire, Paris Spleen

26.quote: “The mountains are calling and I must go.”
26.name: John Muir

27.quote: “Do not train a child to learn by force or harshness; but direct them to it by what amuses their minds, so that you may be better able to discover with accuracy the peculiar bent of the genius of each.”
27.name: Plato

28.quote: “You never know what life is like, until you have lived it.”
28.name: Marilyn Monroe

29.quote: “If you are a student you should always get a good nights sleep unless you have come to the good part of your book, and then you should stay up all night and let your schoolwork fall by the wayside, a phrase which means 'flunk'.”
29.name: Lemony Snicket

0.quote: “What's terrible is to pretend that second-rate is first-rate. To pretend that you don't need love when you do; or you like your work when you know quite well you're capable of better.”
0.name: Doris Lessing, The Golden Notebook

1.quote: “There are perhaps many causes worth dying for, but to me, certainly, there are none worth killing for.”
1.name: Albert Dietrich, Army GI, Pacifist CO: The World War II Letters of Frank Dietrich and Albert Dietrich

2.quote: “Real generosity towards the future lies in giving all to the present.”
2.name: Albert Camus, Notebooks 1935-1942

3.quote: “I love you as certain dark things are loved, secretly, between the shadow and the soul.”
3.name: Pablo Neruda, 100 Love Sonnets

4.quote: “We don’t need a list of rights and wrongs, tables of dos and don’ts: we need books, time, and silence. Thou shalt not is soon forgotten, but Once upon a time lasts forever.”
4.name: Philip Pullman

5.quote: “Unfortunately, the clock is ticking, the hours are going by. The past increases, the future recedes. Possibilities decreasing, regrets mounting.”
5.name: Haruki Murakami, Dance Dance Dance

6.quote: “There is a saying in Tibetan, 'Tragedy should be utilized as a source of strength.'No matter what sort of difficulties, how painful experience is, if we lose our hope, that's our real disaster.”
6.name: Dalai Lama XIV

7.quote: “And Lot's wife, of course, was told not to look back where all those people and their homes had been. But she did look back, and I love her for that, because it was so human. So she was turned into a pillar of salt. So it goes.”
7.name: Kurt Vonnegut, Slaughterhouse-Five

8.quote: “After a good dinner one can forgive anybody, even one's own relations.”
8.name: Oscar Wilde, A Woman of No Importance

9.quote: “History does not always repeat itself. Sometimes it just yells, 'Can't you remember anything I told you?' and lets fly with a club.”
9.name: John W. Campbell Jr.

10.quote: “The mind I love must have wild places.”
10.name: Katherine Mansfield

11.quote: “Stop fighting me!" he said, trying to pull on the arm he held.He was in a precarious position himself, straddling the rail as he tried to lean over far enough to get me and actually hold onto me.“Let go of me!”
11.name: yelled back.But he was too strong and managed to haul most of me over the rail, enough so that I wasn’t in total danger of falling again.See, here’s the thing. In that moment before I let go, I really had been contemplating my death. I’d come to terms with it and accepted it. I also, however, had known Dimitri might do something exactly like this. He was just that fast and that good. That was why I was holding my stake in the hand that was dangling free.I looked him in the eye. "I will always love you."Then I plunged the stake into his chest.It wasn’t as precise a blow as I would have liked, not with the skilled way he was dodging. I struggled to get the stake in deep enough to his heart, unsure if I could do it from this angle. Then, his struggles stopped. His eyes stared at me, stunned, and his lips parted, almost into a smile, albeit a grisly and pained one."That’s what I was supposed to say. . .” he gasped out.Those were his last words.” ― Richelle Mead, Blood Promise

12.quote: “To give pleasure to a single heart by a single act is better than a thousand heads bowing in prayer.”
12.name: Mahatma Gandhi

13.quote: “Fiction is the lie through which we tell the truth.”
13.name: Albert Camus

14.quote: “Lord, what fools these mortals be!”
14.name: William Shakespeare, A Midsummer Night's Dream

15.quote: “A concept is a brick. It can be used to build a courthouse of reason. Or it can be thrown through the window.”
15.name: Gilles Deleuze, A Thousand Plateaus: Capitalism and Schizophrenia

16.quote: “I like this place and could willingly waste my time in it.”
16.name: William Shakespeare

17.quote: “We are all born sexual creatures,thank God, but it's a pity so many people despise and crush this natural gift.”
17.name: Marilyn Monroe

18.quote: “It's only those who do nothing that make no mistakes, I suppose.”
18.name: Joseph Conrad, An Outcast of the Islands

19.quote: “We sometimes encounter people, even perfect strangers, who begin to interest us at first sight, somehow suddenly, all at once, before a word has been spoken.”
19.name: Fyodor Dostoyevsky, Crime and Punishment

20.quote: “Man often becomes what he believes himself to be. If I keep on saying to myself that I cannot do a certain thing, it is possible that I may end by really becoming incapable of doing it. On the contrary, if I have the belief that I can do it, I shall surely acquire the capacity to do it even if I may not have it at the beginning.”
20.name: Mahatma Gandhi

21.quote: “Ask for what you want and be prepared to get it!”
21.name: Maya Angelou

22.quote: “Oh, we're playing nice now? Shall we have tea first? Brew up a nice pot of kiss-my-ass?”
22.name: Julie Kagawa, The Iron King

23.quote: “When I'm good, I'm very good, but when I'm bad, I'm better. ”
23.name: Mae West

24.quote: “This is where it all begins. Everything starts here, today.”
24.name: David Nicholls, One Day

25.quote: “The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.”
25.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

26.quote: “Reading is like thinking, like praying, like talking to a friend, like expressing your ideas, like listening to other people's ideas, like listening to music, like looking at the view, like taking a walk on the beach.”
26.name: Roberto Bolaño, 2666

27.quote: “So we shall let the reader answer this question for himself: who is the happier man, he who has braved the storm of life and lived or he who has stayed securely on shore and merely existed?”
27.name: Hunter S. Thompson

28.quote: “Grown-ups never understand anything by themselves, and it is tiresome for children to be always and forever explaining things to them”
28.name: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry, The Little Prince

29.quote: “The easy confidence with which I know another man's religion is folly teaches me to suspect that my own is also.”
29.name: Mark Twain

0.quote: “Learn the rules, break the rules, make up new rules, break the new rules.”
0.name: Marvin Bell

1.quote: “Every weirdo in the world is on my wavelength.”
1.name: Thomas Pynchon

2.quote: “Life has no remote....get up and change it yourself!”
2.name: Mark A. Cooper, Operation Einstein

3.quote: “You're something between a dream and a miracle.”
3.name: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

4.quote: “If I am not good to myself, how can I expect anyone else to be good to me?”
4.name: Maya Angelou

5.quote: “Listen with curiosity. Speak with honesty. Act with integrity. The greatest problem with communication is we don’t listen to understand. We listen to reply. When we listen with curiosity, we don’t listen with the intent to reply. We listen for what’s behind the words.”
5.name: Roy T. Bennett, The Light in the Heart

6.quote: “It is better to offer no excuse than a bad one.”
6.name: George Washington

7.quote: “Passion makes a person stop eating, sleeping, working, feeling at peace. A lot of people are frightened because, when it appears, it demolishes all the old things it finds in its path. No one wants their life thrown into chaos. That is why a lot of people keep that threat under control, and are somehow capable of sustaining a house or a structure that is already rotten. They are the engineers of the superseded. Other people think exactly the opposite: they surrender themselves without a second thought, hoping to find in passion the solutions to all their problems. They make the other person responsible for their happiness and blame them for their possible unhappiness. They are either euphoric because something marvelous has happened or depressed because something unexpected has just ruined everything. Keeping passion at bay or surrendering blindly to it - which of these two attitudes is the least destructive? I don't know.”
7.name: Paulo Coelho, Eleven Minutes

8.quote: “Throw your dreams into space like a kite, and you do not know what it will bring back, a new life, a new friend, a new love, a new country.”
8.name: Anais Nin

9.quote: “Others have seen what is and asked why. I have seen what could be and asked why not. ”
9.name: Pablo Picasso, Pablo Picasso: Metamorphoses of the Human Form : Graphic Works, 1895-1972

10.quote: “May your trails be crooked, winding, lonesome, dangerous, leading to the most amazing view.”
10.name: Edward Abbey

11.quote: “I'm afraid that sometimes you'll play lonely games too. Games you can't win 'cause you'll play against you.”
11.name: Dr. Seuss

12.quote: “Seventeen, eh!" said Hagrid as he accepted a bucket-sized glass of wine from Fred."Six years to the day we met, Harry, d’yeh remember it?""Vaguely," said Harry, grinning up at him. "Didn’t you smash down the front door, give Dudley a pig’s tail, and tell me I was a wizard?""I forge’ the details," Hagrid chortled.”
12.name: J.K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

13.quote: “The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.”
13.name: Confucius, Confucius: The Analects

14.quote: “And then I felt sad because I realized that once people are broken in certain ways, they can't ever be fixed, and this is something nobody ever tells you when you are young and it never fails to surprise you as you grow older as you see the people in your life break one by one. You wonder when your turn is going to be, or if it's already happened.”
14.name: Douglas Coupland, Life After God

15.quote: “I am going to take this bucket of water and pour it on the flames of hell, and then I am going to use this torch to burn down the gates of paradise so that people will not love God for want of heaven or fear of hell, but because He is God.”
15.name: John Green, Looking for Alaska

16.quote: “Life is like a prism. What you see depends on how you turn the glass.”
16.name: Jonathan Kellerman

17.quote: “Love makes your soul crawl out from its hiding place.”
17.name: Zora Neale Hurston

18.quote: “I am not what happened to me, I am what I choose to become.”
18.name: Carl Gustav Jung

19.quote: “I hope you find someone you can't live without.I really do. And I hope you never have to know what it's like to have to try and live without them.”
19.name: Kiera Cass, The Selection

20.quote: “To lose balance sometimes for love is part of living a balancedlife.”
20.name: Elizabeth Gilbert, Eat, Pray, Love: One Woman's Search for Everything

21.quote: “I'm going to keep going until I succeed — or die. Don't think I don't know how this might end. I've known it for years.”
21.name: J.K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

22.quote: “You have everything needed for the extravagant journey that is your life.”
22.name: Carlos Castaneda

23.quote: “Don't let the muggles get you down.”
23.name: J.K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban

24.quote: “When things break, it's not the actual breaking that prevents them from getting back together again. It's because a little piece gets lost - the two remaining ends couldn't fit together even if they wanted to. The whole shape has changed.”
24.name: John Green, Will Grayson, Will Grayson

25.quote: “Help others without any reason and give without the expectation of receiving anything in return.”
25.name: Roy T. Bennett, The Light in the Heart

26.quote: “Tiger got to hunt, bird got to fly;Man got to sit and wonder 'why, why, why?'Tiger got to sleep, bird got to land;Man got to tell himself he understand.”
26.name: Kurt Vonnegut, Cat's Cradle

27.quote: “My grandmother started walking five miles a day when she was sixty. She's ninety-seven now, and we don't know where the heck she is.”
27.name: Ellen DeGeneres

28.quote: “What is that feeling when you're driving away from people and they recede on the plain till you see their specks dispersing? - it's the too-huge world vaulting us, and it's good-bye. But we lean forward to the next crazy venture beneath the skies.”
28.name: Jack Kerouac, On the Road

29.quote: “Happiness is something that comes into our lives through doors we don't even remember leaving open.”
29.name: Rose Wilder Lane

0.quote: “Never leave a friend behind. Friends are all we have to get us through this life--and they are the only things from this world that we could hope to see in the next.”
0.name: Dean Koontz, Fear Nothing

1.quote: “If you win, you need not have to explain...If you lose, you should not be there to explain!”
1.name: Adolf Hitler

2.quote: “I think and think and think, I‘ve thought myself out of happiness one million times, but never once into it.”
2.name: Jonathan Safran Foer

3.quote: “Poetry is what gets lost in translation.”
3.name: Robert Frost

4.quote: “I know some who are constantly drunk on books as other men are drunk on whiskey.”
4.name: H.L. Mencken

5.quote: “Whenever you think or you believe or you know, you're a lot of other people: but the moment you feel, you're nobody-but-yourself.”
5.name: e.e. cummings

6.quote: “Ideally, what should be said to every child, repeatedly, throughout his or her school life is something like this: 'You are in the process of being indoctrinated. We have not yet evolved a system of education that is not a system of indoctrination. We are sorry, but it is the best we can do. What you are being taught here is an amalgam of current prejudice and the choices of this particular culture. The slightest look at history will show how impermanent these must be. You are being taught by people who have been able to accommodate themselves to a regime of thought laid down by their predecessors. It is a self-perpetuating system. Those of you who are more robust and individual than others will be encouraged to leave and find ways of educating yourself — educating your own judgements. Those that stay must remember, always, and all the time, that they are being moulded and patterned to fit into the narrow and particular needs of this particular society.”
6.name: Doris Lessing, The Golden Notebook

7.quote: “I am a forest, and a night of dark trees: but he who is not afraid of my darkness, will find banks full of roses under my cypresses.”
7.name: Friedrich Nietzsche, Thus Spoke Zarathustra

8.quote: “The starting point of all achievement is DESIRE. Keep this constantly in mind. Weak desire brings weak results, just as a small fire makes a small amount of heat.”
8.name: Napoleon Hill, Think and Grow Rich: The Landmark Bestseller Now Revised and Updated for the 21st Century

9.quote: “If he loved with all the powers of his puny being, he couldn't love as much in eighty years as I could in a day.”
9.name: Emily Brontë, Wuthering Heights

10.quote: “When we are children we seldom think of the future. This innocence leaves us free to enjoy ourselves as few adults can. The day we fret about the future is the day we leave our childhood behind.”
10.name: Patrick Rothfuss, The Name of the Wind

11.quote: “I restore myself when I'm alone.”
11.name: Marilyn Monroe

12.quote: “Fire-breathing bitch-queen.”
12.name: Sarah J. Maas, Queen of Shadows

13.quote: “Being the richest man in the cemetery doesn't matter to me. Going to bed at night saying we've done something wonderful... that's what matters to me.”
13.name: Steve Jobs

14.quote: “Happiness is not the absence of problems, it's the ability to deal with them.”
14.name: Steve Maraboli, Life, the Truth, and Being Free

15.quote: “We are always the same age inside. ”
15.name: Gertrude Stein

16.quote: “It is easy to forget how full the world is of people, full to bursting, and each of them imaginable and consistently misimagined.”
16.name: John Green, Paper Towns

17.quote: “If you want to be happy, be.”
17.name: Tolstoy Leo

18.quote: “I opened myself to the gentle indifference of the world.”
18.name: Albert Camus, L'Étranger

19.quote: “Push yourself. Don't Settle. Just live well. Just LIVE.”
19.name: Jojo Moyes, Me Before You

20.quote: “The sad truth is the truth is sad.”
20.name: Lemony Snicket, The Hostile Hospital

21.quote: “Man, when you lose your laugh you lose your footing.”
21.name: Ken Kesey, One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

22.quote: “Life doesn't imitate art, it imitates bad television.”
22.name: Woody Allen

23.quote: “Ignite, my love. Ignite.”
23.name: Tahereh Mafi, Ignite Me

24.quote: “Nothing on earth can make up for the loss of one who has loved you.”
24.name: Selma Lagerlöf

25.quote: “If you let people into your life a little bit, they can be pretty damn amazing.”
25.name: Sherman Alexie, The Absolutely True Diary of a Part-Time Indian

26.quote: “That's the thing about girls. Every time they do something pretty, even if they're not much to look at, or even if they're sort of stupid, you fall in love with them, and then you never know where the hell you are. Girls. Jesus Christ. They can drive you crazy. They really can.”
26.name: J.D. Salinger, The Catcher in the Rye

27.quote: “Question everything. Your love, your religion, your passion. If you don't have questions, you'll never find answers.”
27.name: Colleen Hoover, Slammed

28.quote: “I don't suffer from my insanity -- I enjoy every minute of it.”
28.name: Sherrilyn Kenyon, Dance with the Devil

29.quote: “Holding people away from you, and denying yourself love, that doesn't make you strong. if anything, it makes you weaker. Because you're doing it out of fear.”
29.name: Sarah Dessen, This Lullaby

0.quote: “Spring is the time of plans and projects.”
0.name: Leo Tolstoy, Anna Karenina

1.quote: “No one is useless in this world who lightens the burdens of another.”
1.name: Charles Dickens

2.quote: “Sometimes it takes a good fall to really know where you stand”
2.name: Hayley Williams

3.quote: “Damn, Claire. Warn a guy before you do a face-plant on the floor next time. I could have looked all heroic and caught you or something -Shane”
3.name: Rachel Caine, Glass Houses

4.quote: “Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.”
4.name: Confucius

5.quote: “We do not remember days, we remember moments.”
5.name: Jennifer Niven, All the Bright Places

6.quote: “We live as we dream--alone....”
6.name: Joseph Conrad, Heart of Darkness

7.quote: “Peace cannot be kept by force; it can only be achieved by understanding.”
7.name: Albert Einstein

8.quote: “Can you be a girl for a few seconds?""I'm always a girl" I frown."You know what I mean. Like a silly, annoying girl"I twirl my hair around my finger. "Kay.”
8.name: Veronica Roth, Divergent

9.quote: “I just want you to know that you’re very special… and the only reason I’m telling you is that I don’t know if anyone else ever has.”
9.name: Stephen Chbosky, The Perks of Being a Wallflower

10.quote: “I don't want to be married just to be married. I can't think of anything lonelier than spending the rest of my life with someone I can't talk to, or worse, someone I can't be silent with.”
10.name: Mary Ann Shaffer, The Guernsey Literary and Potato Peel Pie Society

11.quote: “If we listened to our intellect we'd never have a love affair. We'd never have a friendship. We'd never go in business because we'd be cynical: "It's gonna go wrong." Or "She's going to hurt me." Or,"I've had a couple of bad love affairs, so therefore . . ." Well, that's nonsense. You're going to miss life. You've got to jump off the cliff all the time and build your wings on the way down.”
11.name: Ray Bradbury

12.quote: “Morality is simply the attitude we adopt towards people we personally dislike.”
12.name: Oscar Wilde, An Ideal Husband

13.quote: “I am not an angel,' I asserted; 'and I will not be one till I die: I will be myself. Mr. Rochester, you must neither expect nor exact anything celestial of me - for you will not get it, any more than I shall get it of you: which I do not at all anticipate.”
13.name: Charlotte Brontë, Jane Eyre

14.quote: “Poetry is what happens when nothing else can.”
14.name: Charles Bukowski

15.quote: “There is no point treating a depressed person as though she were just feeling sad, saying, 'There now, hang on, you'll get over it.' Sadness is more or less like a head cold- with patience, it passes. Depression is like cancer.”
15.name: Barbara Kingsolver, The Bean Trees

16.quote: “Dare to live the life you have dreamed for yourself. Go forward and make your dreams come true.”
16.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

17.quote: “If you try to fail, and succeed, which have you done?”
17.name: George Carlin

18.quote: “You may tell a tale that takes up residence in someone's soul, becomes their blood and self and purpose. That tale will move them and drive them and who knows that they might do because of it, because of your words. That is your role, your gift.”
18.name: Erin Morgenstern, The Night Circus

19.quote: “Silly things do cease to be silly if they are done by sensible people in an impudent way.”
19.name: Jane Austen, Emma

20.quote: “As long as she thinks of a man, nobody objects to a woman thinking.”
20.name: Virginia Woolf, Orlando

21.quote: “What is honor compared to a woman's love? What is duty against the feel of a newborn son in your arms . . . or the memory of a brother's smile? Wind and words. Wind and words. We are only human, and the gods have fashioned us for love. That is our great glory, and our great tragedy.”
21.name: George R.R. Martin, A Game of Thrones

22.quote: “If everybody minded their own business, the world would go around a great deal faster than it does.”
22.name: Lewis Caroll, Alice in Wonderland

23.quote: “I didn’t go to religion to make me happy. I always knew a bottle of Port would do that. If you want a religion to make you feel really comfortable, I certainly don’t recommend Christianity.”
23.name: C. S. Lewis

24.quote: “The most authentic thing about us is our capacity to create, to overcome, to endure, to transform, to love and to be greater than our suffering.”
24.name: Ben Okri

25.quote: “My only love sprung from my only hate!Too early seen unknown, and known too late!Prodigious birth of love it is to me,That I must love a loathed enemy.”
25.name: William Shakespeare

26.quote: “This is what we call love. When you are loved, you can do anything in creation. When you are loved, there's no need at all to understand what's happening, because everything happens within you.”
26.name: Paulo Coelho, The Alchemist

27.quote: “I feel free and strong. If I were not a reader of books I could not feel this way.”
27.name: Walter Tevis

28.quote: “If I should have a daughter…“Instead of “Mom”
28.name: he’s gonna call me “Point B.” Because that way, she knows that no matter what happens, at least she can always find her way to me. And I’m going to paint the solar system on the back of her hands so that she has to learn the entire universe before she can say “Oh, I know that like the back of my hand.”She’s gonna learn that this life will hit you, hard, in the face, wait for you to get back up so it can kick you in the stomach. But getting the wind knocked out of you is the only way to remind your lungs how much they like the taste of air. There is hurt, here, that cannot be fixed by band-aids or poetry, so the first time she realizes that Wonder-woman isn’t coming, I’ll make sure she knows she doesn’t have to wear the cape all by herself. Because no matter how wide you stretch your fingers, your hands will always be too small to catch all the pain you want to heal. Believe me, I’ve tried.And “Baby,” I’ll tell her “don’t keep your nose up in the air like that, I know that trick, you’re just smelling for smoke so you can follow the trail back to a burning house so you can find the boy who lost everything in the fire to see if you can save him. Or else, find the boy who lit the fire in the first place to see if you can change him.”But I know that she will anyway, so instead I’ll always keep an extra supply of chocolate and rain boats nearby, ‘cause there is no heartbreak that chocolate can’t fix. Okay, there’s a few heartbreaks chocolate can’t fix. But that’s what the rain boots are for, because rain will wash away everything if you let it.I want her to see the world through the underside of a glass bottom boat, to look through a magnifying glass at the galaxies that exist on the pin point of a human mind. Because that’s how my mom taught me. That there’ll be days like this, “There’ll be days like this my momma said” when you open your hands to catch and wind up with only blisters and bruises. When you step out of the phone booth and try to fly and the very people you wanna save are the ones standing on your cape. When your boots will fill with rain and you’ll be up to your knees in disappointment and those are the very days you have all the more reason to say “thank you,” ‘cause there is nothing more beautiful than the way the ocean refuses to stop kissing the shoreline no matter how many times it’s sent away.You will put the “wind” in win some lose some, you will put the “star” in starting over and over, and no matter how many land mines erupt in a minute be sure your mind lands on the beauty of this funny place called life.And yes, on a scale from one to over-trusting I am pretty damn naive but I want her to know that this world is made out of sugar. It can crumble so easily but don’t be afraid to stick your tongue out and taste it.“Baby,” I’ll tell her “remember your mama is a worrier but your papa is a warrior and you are the girl with small hands and big eyes who never stops asking for more.”Remember that good things come in threes and so do bad things and always apologize when you’ve done something wrong but don’t you ever apologize for the way your eyes refuse to stop shining.Your voice is small but don’t ever stop singing and when they finally hand you heartbreak, slip hatred and war under your doorstep and hand you hand-outs on street corners of cynicism and defeat, you tell them that they really ought to meet your mother.” ― Sarah Kay

29.quote: “Never attempt to teach a pig to sing; it wastes your time and annoys the pig.”
29.name: Robert Heinlein, Time Enough for Love

0.quote: “I address you all tonight for who you truly are: wizards, mermaids, travelers, adventurers, and magicians. You are the true dreamers.”
0.name: Brian Selznick, The Invention of Hugo Cabret

1.quote: “The unhappiest people in this world, are those who care the most about what other people think.”
1.name: C. JoyBell C.

2.quote: “One must dare to be happy. ”
2.name: Gertrude Stein

3.quote: “In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity”
3.name: Albert Einstein

4.quote: “I just want to be wonderful.”
4.name: Marilyn Monroe

5.quote: “You think the dead we loved ever truly leave us? You think that we don't recall them more clearly in times of great trouble?”
5.name: J.K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban

6.quote: “People are capable, at any time in their lives, of doing what they dream of.”
6.name: Paulo Coelho, The Alchemist

7.quote: “I clench his hands to the point of pain. "Stay with me."His pupils contract to pinpoints, dialate again rapidly, and then return to something resembling normalcy. "Always," he murmurs.”
7.name: Suzanne Collins, Mockingjay

8.quote: “The Darkling slumped back in his chair. “Fine,”
8.name: said with a weary shrug. “Make me your villain.” ― Leigh Bardugo, Shadow and Bone

9.quote: “I find out a lot about myself by sleeping. Dreams, they are who I am when I’m too tired to be me.”
9.name: Jarod Kintz, This Book is Not for Sale

10.quote: “It takes something more than intelligence to act intelligently.”
10.name: Fyodor Dostoyevsky, Crime and Punishment

11.quote: “I have accepted fear as part of life – specifically the fear of change... I have gone ahead despite the pounding in the heart that says: turn back....”
11.name: Erica Jong

12.quote: “People, generally, suck.”
12.name: Christopher Moore, The Stupidest Angel: A Heartwarming Tale of Christmas Terror

13.quote: “True friends are always together in spirit.”
13.name: L.M. Montgomery, Anne of Green Gables

14.quote: “Demons run when a good man goes to warNight will fall and drown the sunWhen a good man goes to warFriendship dies and true love liesNight will fall and the dark will riseWhen a good man goes to warDemons run, but count the costThe battle's won, but the child is lost”
14.name: Steven Moffat

15.quote: “One of the deep secrets of life is that all that is really worth the doing is what we do for others.”
15.name: Lewis Carroll

16.quote: “Threats are the last resort of a man with no vocabulary.”
16.name: Tamora Pierce, Lady Knight

17.quote: “I will take the sun in my mouthand leap into the ripe air Alive with closed eyesto dash against darkness”
17.name: E.E. Cummings, Poems,

18.quote: “I don't care," Clary said. "He'd do it for me. Tell me he wouldn't. If I were missing-" "He'd burn the whole world down till he could dig you out of the ashes. I know," Alec said.”
18.name: Cassandra Clare, City of Lost Souls

19.quote: “Because,' she said, 'when you're scared but you still do it anyway, that's brave.”
19.name: Neil Gaiman, Coraline

20.quote: “Whatever you do, you need courage. Whatever course you decide upon, there is always someone to tell you that you are wrong. There are always difficulties arising that tempt you to believe your critics are right. To map out a course of action and follow it to an end requires some of the same courage that a soldier needs. Peace has its victories, but it takes brave men and women to win them.”
20.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

21.quote: “It crosses my mind that Cinna's calm and normal demeanor masks a complete madman.”
21.name: Suzanne Collins, The Hunger Games

22.quote: “الحداد ليس في ما نرتديه بل في ما نراه . إنّه يكمن في نظرتناللأشياء . بإمكان عيون قلبنا أن تكون في حداد... ولا أحد يدري بذلك”
22.name: أحلام مستغانمي, الأسود يليق بك

23.quote: “That's what fiction is for. It's for getting at the truth when the truth isn't sufficient for the truth.”
23.name: Tim O'Brien

24.quote: “A question that sometimes drives me hazy: am I or are the others crazy?”
24.name: Albert Einstein

25.quote: “Each night, when I go to sleep, I die. And the next morning, when I wake up, I am reborn.”
25.name: Mahatma Gandhi

26.quote: “This is how it works. I love the people in my life, and I do for my friends whatever they need me to do for them, again and again, as many times as is necessary. For example, in your case you always forgot who you are and how much you're loved. So what I do for you as your friend is remind you who you are and tell you how much I love you. And this isn't any kind of burden for me, because I love who you are very much. Every time I remind you, I get to remember with you, which is my pleasure.”
26.name: James Lecesne

27.quote: “We are all born mad. Some remain so.”
27.name: Samuel Beckett

28.quote: “None of us knows what might happen even the next minute, yet still we go forward. Because we trust. Because we have faith.”
28.name: Paulo Coelho

29.quote: “If you don't go after what you want, you'll never have it. If you don't ask, the answer is always no. If you don't step forward, you're always in the same place.”
29.name: Nora Roberts

0.quote: “sex is the consolation you have when you can't have love”
0.name: Gabriel García Márquez

1.quote: “Half the world is composed of people who have something to say and can't, and the other half who have nothing to say and keep on saying it.”
1.name: Robert Frost

2.quote: “If Peeta and I were both to die, or they thought we were....My fingers fumble with the pouch on my belt, freeing it. Peeta sees it and his hand clamps on my wrist. "No, I won't let you." "Trust me," I whisper. He holds my gaze for a long moment then lets go. I loosen the top of the pouch and pour a few spoonfuls of berries into his palm. Then I fill my own. "On the count of three?" Peeta leans down and kisses me once, very gently. "The count of three," he says. We stand, our backs pressed together, our empty hands locked tight. "Hold them out. I want everyone to see," he says. I spread out my fingers, and the dark berries glisten in the sun. I give Peeta's hand one last squeeze as a signal, as a good-bye, and we begin counting. "One." Maybe I'm wrong. "Two." Maybe they don't care if we both die. "Three!" It's too late to change my mind. I lift my hand to my mouth taking one last look at the world. The berries have just passed my lips when the trumpets begin to blare. The frantic voice of Claudius Templesmith shouts above them. "Stop! Stop! Ladies and gentlemen, I am pleased to present the victors of the 74th Hunger Games, Katniss Everdeen and Peeta Mellark! I give you - the tributes of District 12!”
2.name: Suzanne Collins, The Hunger Games

3.quote: “Imagination is everything. It is the preview of life's coming attractions.”
3.name: Albert Einstein

4.quote: “Hang on, did you just call me Angel?" I asked."If I did?""I don't like it."He grinned. "It stays, Angel.”
4.name: Becca Fitzpatrick, Hush, Hush

5.quote: “If we have no peace, it is because we have forgotten that we belong to each other.”
5.name: Mother Teresa

6.quote: “I like it when a flower or a little tuft of grass grows through a crack in the concrete. It's so fuckin' heroic.”
6.name: George Carlin

7.quote: “Love the world and yourself in it, move through it as though it offers no resistance, as though the world is your natural element.”
7.name: Audrey Niffenegger, The Time Traveler's Wife

8.quote: “You - you alone will have the stars as no one else has them...In one of the stars I shall be living. In one of them I shall be laughing. And so it will be as if all the stars were laughing, when you look at the sky at night...You - only you - will have stars that can laugh.”
8.name: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry, El Principito

9.quote: “Ignorance killed the cat; curiosity was framed!”
9.name: C. J. Cherryh

10.quote: “The mass of men lead lives of quiet desperation. What is called resignation is confirmed desperation. From the desperate city you go into the desperate country, and have to console yourself with the bravery of minks and muskrats. A stereotyped but unconscious despair is concealed even under what are called the games and amusements of mankind. There is no play in them, for this comes after work. But it is a characteristic of wisdom not to do desperate things..”
10.name: Henry David Thoreau, Civil Disobedience and Other Essays

11.quote: “If the person you are talking to doesn't appear to be listening, be patient. It may simply be that he has a small piece of fluff in his ear.”
11.name: A.A. Milne, Winnie-the-Pooh

12.quote: “I've begun to realize that you can listen to silence and learn from it. It has a quality and a dimension all its own.”
12.name: Chaim Potok, The Chosen

13.quote: “I don't hate you.. I just don't like that you exist”
13.name: Gena Showalter, Seduce the Darkness

14.quote: “Your emotions are the slaves to your thoughts, and you are the slave to your emotions.”
14.name: Elizabeth Gilbert, Eat Pray Love: One Woman's Search for Everything Across Italy, India and Indonesia

15.quote: “لا تجزع من جرحك، وإلا فكيف للنور أن يتسلل إلى باطنك؟”
15.name: جلال الدين الرومي

16.quote: “See, the problem is that God gives men a brain and a penis, and only enough blood to run one at a time.”
16.name: Robin Williams

17.quote: “Laugh, even when you feel too sick or too worn out or tired. Smile, even when you're trying not to cry and the tears are blurring your vision. Sing, even when people stare at you and tell you your voice is crappy. Trust, even when your heart begs you not to. Twirl, even when your mind makes no sense of what you see. Frolick, even when you are made fun of. Kiss, even when others are watching. Sleep, even when you're afraid of what the dreams might bring. Run, even when it feels like you can't run any more.And, always, remember, even when the memories pinch your heart. Because the pain of all your experience is what makes you the person you are now. And without your experience---you are an empty page, a blank notebook, a missing lyric. What makes you brave is your willingness to live through your terrible life and hold your head up high the next day. So don't live life in fear. Because you are stronger now, after all the crap has happened, than you ever were back before it started.”
17.name: Alysha Speer

18.quote: “In times of grief and sorrow I will hold you and rock you and take your grief and make it my own. When you cry I cry and when you hurt I hurt. And together we will try to hold back the floods to tears and despair and make it through the potholed street of life”
18.name: Nicholas Sparks, The Notebook

19.quote: “It is very risky. But each time a child opens a book, he pushes open the gate that separates him from Elsewhere.”
19.name: Lois Lowry

20.quote: “The past beats inside me like a second heart.”
20.name: John Banville, The Sea

21.quote: “People think it must be fun to be a super genius, but they don't realize how hard it is to put up with all the idiots in the world.”
21.name: Bill Watterson, The Calvin and Hobbes Tenth Anniversary Book

22.quote: “Listen up - there's no war that will end all wars.”
22.name: Haruki Murakami, Kafka on the Shore

23.quote: “Black hair and blue eyes are my favorite combination.”
23.name: Cassandra Clare, Clockwork Angel

24.quote: “What else? She is so beautiful. You don’t get tired of looking at her. You never worry if she is smarter than you: You know she is. She is funny without ever being mean. I love her. I am so lucky to love her, Van Houten. You don’t get to choose if you get hurt in this world, old man, but you do have some say in who hurts you. I like my choices. I hope she likes hers.”
24.name: John Green, The Fault in Our Stars

25.quote: “I'm not lost for I know where I am. But however, where I am may be lost.”
25.name: A.A. Milne, Winnie-the-Pooh

26.quote: “Sleep, those little slices of death — how I loathe them.”
26.name: Edgar Allan Poe

27.quote: “Dogs are our link to paradise. They don't know evil or jealousy or discontent. To sit with a dog on a hillside on a glorious afternoon is to be back in Eden, where doing nothing was not boring--it was peace.”
27.name: Milan Kundera

28.quote: “Dreams are the touchstones of our characters.”
28.name: Henry David Thoreau

29.quote: “Yes, we praise women over 40 for a multitude of reasons. Unfortunately, it's not reciprocal. For every stunning, smart, well-coiffed, hot woman over 40, there is a bald, paunchy relic in yellow pants making a fool of himself with some 22-year old waitress. Ladies, I apologize. For all those men who say, "Why buy the cow when you can get the milk for free?", here's an update for you. Nowadays 80% of women are against marriage. Why? Because women realize it's not worth buying an entire pig just to get a little sausage!”
29.name: Frank Kaiser
